name: Sean J
text:
Scammers. They did not perform the services they said they were going to. They completely ignored the proper protocol for mold removal and had to be let go mid service. They piled mold contaminated items on top of non contaminated items. They did not seal off contaminated rooms from other areas.
They took advantage of my elderly in-laws.
Would give no stars if possible.

In response to your response. The proper protocol plan that you told my wife you were going to follow was not followed. You set bags of contaminated items on our personal items in a separate room. You stacked contaminated bags against the face of a flatscreen tv. There were pieces of contaminated sheetrock all over the floor in a room that you claimed was clean. Yes, I was upset because of all of this.
As my wife explained to you in the beginning,  she is highly allergic to mold. So, when I saw contaminated items drug through our living room and placed on our non contaminated things, it upset me. I even took pictures of it. I'm sorry your feelings got hurt, but you ruined our things and wasted our time.

We have now discovered that more things were ruined in the bags they carelessly packed. A bottle of shampoo was thrown into a bag where it broke open and poured onto my daughter's $300 camera, the bible she received from us at her Baptism, and many other valuables. That was just one bag. The amount of loss from this company is beyond a money value. Personal, irreplaceable  items were destroyed also.

In response to what you responded to my wife and her comments. All I can say is that you're shameless. We know the difference between  what you said that you would do and what was done...two completely different things. Again, to anyone who reads this...no stars.

resp.text: Sean, Your review is not true or accurate.  Our company followed appropriate protocol which included erecting containment barriers.  There was NO cross-contamination, as you stated.  Our company has been in business since 1979 and we are highly reputable.  All was running smoothly until you entered the picture. What you failed to mention was your erratic behavior towards our crew.  You verbally assaulted our crew and even continued yelling after our crew had exited the house.  You displayed a total lack of self control.  We did not create the mold issues in this house but we are well qualified to remediate any mold problem.  It appears that your personal problems boiled over and you chose to take it out on our crew.  That was a cowardly move.  For clarification- While your in-laws are senior citizens, your description of them as "elderly" invokes an image of feebleness.  Your in-laws appear to be spry, able bodied and mentally fit.  Furthermore, your assertion that we were taking advantage of your in-laws may well be a projection since you - a grown man, are living in your in-laws basement. Your behavior and attempts to discredit our company are/were immature and reprehensible!

name: Paige Janke
text:
LIARS, SCAMMERS & THIEVES!!!!

This review is in addition to the one my husband, Sean, left last week. I met with Rick and his wife at the beginning of August for them to run air sample tests on my parents house. They ran the test in 4 rooms, and called me 2 days later with the results.  When Rick called me he said that the levels of Stachybotrys were among some of the highest indoor levels he had seen in his 15 years of experience. In addition to the phone call I received an email from him with the results and a message stating that it was very dangerous for anyone to enter that area without protective gear on. He also insisted that we allow them to come back out and test 2 more rooms in the same area. He and his wife came back the next day, August 11th or 12th, to run the other 2 tests. WE STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED THE RESULTS FROM THOSE TESTS THAT WE PAID FOR 2 MONTHS AGO. We have asked for the results multiple times and the only answer my Dad got was that the tests came back ok.

Before Paragon Industrial was hired to do the mold remediation, I spoke with Rick and his wife about their protocol for removing contaminated items as to not cross contaminate the other rooms and items. After talking with them at length about how they would do the job, I felt comfortable with the protocol and encouraged my 80 year old father to go with their company.

They told my parents that they needed to run the air scrubbers upstairs and clean the air ducts first. Why would you clean upstairs before you remediate the toxic black mold downstairs? That doesn't even make sense. The mold should have been remediated first, then the air ducts, and last the air scrubbers.

When they came to start the remediation THEY DID NOT FOLLOW ANY OF THE PROTOCOLS THAT THEY HAD EXPLAINED TO ME IN DETAIL BEFORE BEING HIRED! As far as erecting containment barriers, they put up some plastic sheeting with duck tape that began peeling off of the walls and door the same day they were put up. The air conditioning vents were not sealed off and the unit was not shut off while they were ripping moldy Sheetrock down. Also, they threw everything into black garbage bags from the contaminated room and threw it on top of our furniture in the living room causing CROSS CONTAMINATION. There was also moldy Sheetrock strewn down the hall where they drug it out! They explained to me that the Sheetrock would be taken down in small pieces, bagged and sealed before being removed completely from the house.

My ELDERLY father called to tell us what was going on at the house and I told my husband to go make sure things were being done like they said they were going to do them. When my husband, Sean, got to the house he found a huge mess! EVERYTHING HAD BEEN CROSS CONTAMINATED! My husband was in shock at how careless they were being because he was concerned about the impact it would have on my health! We had recently found out that I have lesions on my spine, unusual rashes, peripheral neuropathy, daily debilitating migraines, and chronic sinus infections ALL caused by exposure to black mold. My husband had to leave me alone in bed after being released from the hospital to come over to the house to find out what was going on. That is the reason he reacted the way he did, because he is genuinely concerned about the health of his wife! Any man who saw someone doing something that would bring harm to his family would react the same way!

My father called Rick and released him from the job the next day. He was supposed to return some of the money that my dad had paid upfront, but of course that has not been returned. My parents paid out almost $4000 for them to make a grand mess out of everything!

Since then my parents have had a professional air conditioning company come check the air ducts upstairs that were supposed to be cleaned for $900 and he showed them that they had only been wiped out a couple feet. He inquired about what was paid, and couldn't believe that they paid for the service!!!

I would keep going if google would allow me more characters.

resp.text:
Like your husband, your recollection of events is inaccurate.
The work upstairs was a completely different Indoor Air Quality Issue.  The work upstairs was not mold related.  Because your parents were living in this area, it was the priority.
The work downstairs was performed using industry protocol.
I would like to remind you that we did not cause your mold problem and we did not cause your illness and health problems.
Please stop making false accusations against our company. I wish you the best with your family and your health.

text: Conditioned Air Solutions is hands down the BEST! Lee Hatchett was our service technician today for our yearly maintenance, he is great! Very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. He did an exceptional job! Very happy with our service!

name: Charity Stratton
text: Robert and his crew replaced our heat pump, improved our ductwork and circulation, added more insulation in the attic  and added a thermostat downstairs a few years ago. The house was always drafty downstairs in the winter and hot downstairs in the summer. We had three companies come out and assess what was going on and although his quote was not the cheapest, he was the only one that told us exactly what needed to be done. We ultimately decided that it was worth the expense to have our home be comfortable. That was at least five years ago, and I keep saying “it’s the little things that cost thousands of dollars that really make the difference!” We haven’t regretted spending one penny!

name: Andrea Brown
text: So this man, Robert Atkins and His staff at his company goes so way beyond and it just amazing! You see,  we had a severe issue last week which caused an emergency situation. I called Mr. Atkins in the middle of the night and he actually picked up the phone!! We discussed the situation and he came out that day! He ordered the equipment and as soon as it arrived, which was the following business day, our new unit was installed! We can't thank him and his crew enough! Great Job ACS!

name: Seth Nugent
text: These guys are my go when I have any issues with my HVAC system. They offer maintenance contracts that are affordable. I've also had them fix my unit on a few occasions and they were professional, responsive, on time, and they don't try to upsell you at all. I definitely recommend!

name: jsf5758
text: ACS installed a new heating and cooling system in my home.  They arrived on time, worked until the installation was complete and left with everything neat, clean and assembled well.  The cost for equipment and installation was very reasonable.

name: Kevin Fairclough
text: ACS, INC replaced a gas pack for me. The installation was on time and the installation crew was efficient, competent and careful. In contrast to some other HVAC companies, the owner is very easy to contact.

name: Joe
text: Over the last eleven years, Robert Akins and ACS has provided nothing but high-quality, professional, and responsive service.  When one of my two HVACs went out in my new home, I called the company that installed it and they said the earliest they could come was three days.  When I called ACS, they were there the next morning.  I have been calling on ACS ever since.  During a heat wave, after Robert explained he would have to charge overtime, ACS fixed my HVAC on a Sunday morning.  Whenever ACS was at my house to fix my HVAC, after analyzing the problem, they were clear on what needed to be done,  how long it would take to fix it, how much it would cost, and why.  If necessary, they also provided a variety of payment options so I could choose what best met my situation.  So when one of my two HVACs needed to be replaced, ACS was one of two companies I called for an estimate.  While the other estimate was flowered with discounts for various reasons, the ACS estimate was clear, concise, and competetive.  Robert Akins spent a lot of time explaining options and whether they were worth the expense.  The unit ACS proposed has a lifetime condenser replacement warranty if the compressor ever fails.  An option ACS had that the other did not was a ten year warranty on the labor for warrantied repairs.  Finally, when the competitor said it would take at least a week for the replacement HVAC to come in, ACS had my new unit installed the next day on December 22, the week of Christmas!  So whether you are looking to replace your current HVAC unit or just repair the one you have, I highly recommend Robert Akins and ACS.  They have always been there when I needed them and taken care of the problem efficiently and professionally.

name: FRED RICHARDSON
text: Great customer service. Robert and his technical employees are top notch. He is fair and honest and always does what is best for the customer.

name: Jeremy Fleming
text: ACS recently replaced 2 units for my home.  They arrived on time, completed the work quickly and followed up after the installation.  We will be using them for service in the future.

name: Raychel Zygula
text: Owner is an excellent business man and keeps track of how my systems are running. I've had to replace two compressors as well as some duct work for my home this year, and each time ACS came by to service my home, they have gotten the job done efficiently. I would highly recommend using this company! The prices are fair and the job is top quality.

name: Emily of Earth
text: They were able to come to my house the same day that I called! My technician was very knowledgeable and friendly.

name: William Hastie
text: ACS responded in a reasonable time.  A capacitor was replaced.  The wholesale cost of the capacitor is under $30.  I was charge $130 for the capacitor plus labor to replace it.  Total charge $245.  So, if you do not mind a 300+% markup on material, then you can select ACS.  I will go elsewhere.

resp.text:
It is always a travesty for ACS, Inc. to have an unsatisfied customer and we do all that we can to help our customers have a good experience with us and continue a long term service relationship.  Unfortunately, occasionally, due to whatever reasons whether by our fault or other circumstances, a customer is dissatisfied.  In this case we did not learn of Mr. Hastie's dissatisfaction until he posted a negative review.  There was no phone call, no inquiry, no attempt to communicate or seek a resolution to his complaint, just a negative review.
After speaking to the technician and reviewing the statements associated with this service I found the following facts to be true:

Mr Hastie called to report his house was hot and his air conditioning was not working late in the afternoon.  I diverted a technician to his house after 4:30 pm to help him so that hopefully he would not have to go through another hot night in his house.  (We go on overtime at 5:00 pm).  The technician found the primary problem and responded by installing a part from his truck which was close to what was required but not the correct spec.  The temporary fix allowed the unit to run and cool the house overnight providing immediate relief for Mr. Hastie.  The technician did not charge for the overtime.

The part required was an odd spec which the technicians and many of our professional vendors do not carry locally (often an order Item).  The next day our technician searched among our vendors until he found a part locally.  He returned to the Hastie residence and exchanged the temporary part for the correct one.  Our technician also inspected the refrigerant charge and found a need to add some refrigerant to achieve the correct cooling specs per his instruments upon this return visit.

Moreover, our technician did not charge Mr. Hastie for the procurement or travel time required to serve his needs.  For the more than 3 hours time involved working exclusively on Mr. Hastie's behalf our technician charge him only for a service call and 1 hour labor.  As far as the cost of the part:  yes we, like most service operations who provide a responsive service, charge a markup on parts.  We do not attempt to compete with internet pricing.  Our pricing structure reflects the convenience of having the part, our vendors supporting us to have a part available, and the network which guarantees and supports the quick response business.

Otherwise, a client is free to diagnose his own problem, order his parts online and wait in the heat until the part arrives (hoping he did not make a mistake or that a wrong part was shipped.)

In conclusion:  Our technician followed pricing guidelines which have been satisfactory for our extensive client base for more than 40 years.  He waived labor costs in the hopes of establishing Mr. Hastie as a long term satisfied customer.  Mr. Hastie indicated to the technician that he was satisfied and grateful for the prompt service and relief from the heat.

Had Mr. Hastie called to inquire about the charges, we could have explained to him and even offered him a coupon if he was still not happy.  Personally, I see this negative review as simply malicious with the intent of harming our otherwise excellent review status and without any interest in understanding or seeking a resolution with ACS, Inc.

name: Nathan
text: Called to get information on a repair. Instead all I received was a smart aleck and demeaning response followed with profanity. Extremely unprofessional. If someone speaks this way towards potential business, I highly question their ethical standards in performing a repair. AVOID.

resp.text:
I remember this caller.  Nathan called and began asking me vague questions about what was wrong with his heating system.  I told him that it sounded like we needed to send a tech out for diagnostics.  He asked me what the charge would be and I told him the minimum cost of a service call and labor for a call out.  He then asked me an unusual question for our industry.  He asked me why we charged for diagnostics.  From having dealt with the public for 40 years I understood that he was not familiar with how service companies operate.  I proceeded to explain to him why a company had to charge to send a tech to a remote location, time, equipment cost, travel, insurance, education and training, overhead and all of the costs associated with a working company.  I explained that the tech, for instance, had to be paid from the moment he clocked in which included the driving time to a residence and back, hence the service call.  Nathan took offense at the explanation and told me that he did not need a "lecture".  I asked him then why he asked such a question if he did not expect or want a comprehensive answer, to which he abruptly hung up the phone. There was no profanity.  Moments later this negative review arrived in my email.

Part of the service we provide is educational.  We are a very empirical and logic based company.  We deal with applied science.  When a question is asked we do our best to answer it thoroughly.  I often help clients solve heating and air conditioning issues over the phone at no charge when able.  I have recently successfully instructed non technical house wives in restoring their heat over the phone. My communication skills are very good.  In this circumstance it was very important that the potential client understood the charges and per his questions why there were charges.  If the customer does not understand that he will be charged for a visit and that he has an obligation to pay, or if he protests the value of the service prior to a visit by a tech, then we cannot send a tech to his residence.

Unfortunately, part of the job of dealing with the general public is to screen the potential client to make sure that the interaction with the company and the technician is successful and satisfactory for both parties.  We will not send a technician into a contentious situation.  We would have liked to have helped Nathan but the initial phone interaction and the "hang up" indicated that the interaction would not be successful.

text: It was honestly a really great experience from start to finish. My wife met with Cason and we went into wanting multiple options which i thought were all fairly presented and well explained without any pressure of which to go with. I have a close friend who worked for many years for both Trane and Carrier with many of the dealers throughout Birmingham. He gave me a list of 3 companies he would have out to his home personally. Skelton was one of those, another company that i liked very much, and then one we didnt have a great experience on the quote with. Between Skelton and the other competitor, although Skeltons price was higher we were sold by the labor warranty and some of the other written guarantees, along with the rec from our friend. Installation - I believe it was Mark, my wife was the one on site - went way better than i could have imagined. We arranged last minute to have the unit moved to a new location. All of the work was very well done. I had an idea in my head of what "the aftermath" should have looked like and the equipment involved in the move and all that, and i probably would have been satisfied with a lot less. Its obviously a lot of money for most families, so I was bound to have some mix of buyers remorse and hesitation about whether or not we'd gone with the right people However, when i got home and saw the quality of the work, how neatly and efficiently and professionally everything was done, i immediately felt entirely confident in our decision and knew we had some true professionals out at the house. I think its the first time in my life ive spent that much money on something and dont have any regrets or second guessing about who we chose to spend it with. Kudos to both Cason and Mark's teams. name: Louis Dina
text: My 15 year old AC unit was recharged about 5 weeks ago. When it stopped working again, I assumed all the Freon leaked out again and that it needed replacement. I asked Skelton’s to give a quote on a replacement unit. Their technician was very thorough and discovered a bad switch and capacitor, which he replaced on the spot. He checked our Freon levels and said they were still perfect. His extra effort and honesty saved us from having to buy a new unit at this time, even though he could have easily convinced me we needed a new unit. (Two other companies also provided quotes on new units, but neither of them discovered the underlying issue.) Honesty and integrity, and a desire to serve the customer’s best interests, are important to me. Skelton’s proved it by their actions. When it is time for a replacement AC system, I’ll call Skelton’s.

name: Jay Miller
text:
My 94 year old Dad's AC system went out on a Thursday afternoon in rural Alabama with the heat index well over 100. Justin promptly called me back and was out to check the system before the end of business that same day. The entire system had to be replaced so it couldnt be resolved that day. Justin lined up Wes and his crew so that they could begin the replacement first thing once the system was delivered. I was told everything would be good to go by 1pm. My Dad and I arrived at 12pm and Wes told me all they needed was access to the thermostat and they would be finished. This group understood the critical situation my Dad was in and went above and beyond to make sure his unit was installed and operating ASAP.
Thank you so much guys...you'll never know how much it meant to my Dad to get back to his home.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Miller for the great review! We are happy to hear about your that you were pleased with job and technicians. Thanks again for choosing Skelton's Heating & Air.

name: Doug Tilt
text:
I remodeled a room in my lake house which required repositioning the main intake vent from a vertical in -wall position to an in-floor register.  Brian Skelton , company owner, came out the day after my call, evaluated the job and provided a best guess estimate for the proposed task
The following day a team of two technicians  arrived at 0800 , as agreed. Within 4 hours the old vent box was removed, a new floor frame between the joists was constructed, a new box placed and large duct connected to the existing AC/ Heating unit and new ,sturdy floor grate placed( and thermostat repositioned)

The Skelton team were most professional and efficient.  The job site was completely cleaned and everything double checked to be sure everything was done to my satisfaction and functioning well. An immediate follow up call to me by company owner was appreciated.

The total cost was $960.00 based on labor and materials , which was as expected per initial estimate

My five star rating was completely deserved based on professionalism, punctuality, job done, and charge. I definitely recommend this company and will use them again.

Doug Tilt

text:
I will never use this service again!!! I don't know if what happened to me, happened to anyone else but, on Friday, May03rd, I turned my A C on for the first time because I knew the colder weather had passed on by.once I turn my air on, I keep it on72degrees no matter what cause I also have ceiling fans and floor fans which helps to keep my power bill down. Well, the A C didn't come on so I called American Home Warranty which provided me with my info and called Same Day maintenance (cause I've used them before to install a thermostat in my home), the technician came out flipped the switch on and never went outback to check my unit...naturally I was happy because now I'm knowing I have air. Kept my doors and windows opened and up until around7:30 because it was really hot inside and I didn't want the unit to work as hard cooling the house inside. 3:00 before day Saturday morning; I was drenched in sweat.not understanding what's happened, got up, checked the A C inside..on. Went out back, checked the unit..no fan turning, unit very hot..turned off A C inside, called SameDay around 8:00 that morning, left emergency message..no return called. Called again all day every30 minutes- an hour...no phone call. Same repeat for Sunday. Monday morning I was on the phone calling them from7:30 until the answering machine picked up and I asked them to please call me back..didn't call me, I called back again finally getting someone who told me they would check with the tec. to see when he can come b out( mind you, this is a re-call) so I should have been a priority along with other people who had an emergency over the week-end not wait until Wednesday to try and work me in. I was told Wednesday morning that the Tec. would be out between 1and 5pm. Okay... I'm trying to hold my self in check because now I'm feeling disrespected and ignored. 4:35 no Tech..I called their office back after the 2nd phone call I was told this guy name Andy would give me a call...what???
It's already4:55 I said" call me" he should be here by now i2don't need him to call me.. She said" that's what he told me to tell you" . long story....so he called5:10 said he would look at his schedule and see if he could get to me tomorrow( Thursday)....I'm sooo pissed now, hot and disgusted...called American Residential warranty back, explained this same thing to them and told them I will not use Same Day Maintenance anymore and to place that notation on the computer by my name...so now I'm searching the internet trying to find someone else who will come out asap to get me up and running......I recommend no body uses this service...at all. I know for some people it works find for you, but there are those of us who feel it's a race thing( that's my own observation people) if it works for you...more power to ya!!!👺👺👺👹👎👎👎

text: My house is 50 years old, and doubt most of the 12 ducts had ever been cleaned. I would get sneezing attacks at least once  a week. The dust had won the battle, it was a daily fight. I called Duct Cleaning Solution, LLC and Kenny came out and inspected the ducts and vents. He explained the process and procedure thoroughly. We set an appointment, which we did reschedule due to pending rainstorms, but Kenny called and explained how the process works best on non-rainy days. I was good with that. Kenny kept me informed and communicated with me from the original contact until the job was done. Best $85 I've spent in the 6 years I have owned this old house. Now a month later, I have NOT had a sneezing attack, the dust storm has literally disappeared.  I HIGHLY recommend Kenny Gunnels and Duct Cleaning Solution, LLC.  Now a month in, KNOWING the RESULTS, I think they are WAY to INEXPENSIVE. I would NOT have blinked at twice the price.  Give Kenny a call, you will NOT regret it.

name: Greyson Fernandez
text:
I used Duct Cleaning Solution LLC to clean HVAC ducts located in a crawl space that recently had extensive work done to remove mold growth. After our sub-contractor spent 3 days soda blasting each floor joist we knew the next step was to call Kenny to assist us in improving the air quality inside the ducts. He worked with our schedules to ensure that our other sub-contractors had time to complete their work and explained to us the scope of the project and provided a detail estimate before scheduling the project. What separates Kenny from other duct cleaning companies is his National Air Duct Cleaners Association (NADCA) certification and sizable investment in a truck mounted vacuum truck. This ensures that there is enough negative air pressure (CFM) to remove all the foreign debris and particles that have collected over the years.

Give Kenny a call whenever you need to clean your ducts and improve the air quality inside your home. I highly recommend Kenny Gunnels with Duct Cleaning Solution, LLC, his work ethic and commitment to ensure everything is done correctly will impress everyone that hires him.

Consider having your ducts routinely cleaned every 3-5 years, whenever a major renovation occurs, during change over between tenants, or after you purchase a new house.

resp.text: Greyson - we are pleased to know you are happy with our service. We value customer satisfaction from start to finish. We believe our certifications of Air Systems Cleaning Specialist (ASCS) and Ventilation System Mold Remediator (VSMR) through NADCA are essential in ensuring that all of our work is performed to the industry standard in air duct cleaning. Thank you so much for the five star review! As, we appreciate our customers feedback.

name: Chris Short
text: Great work, lots of before and after photos. Huge difference afterwards in the photos.

resp.text: Thank you Chris! We love before and after photos to ensure that you see the quality of our air duct cleaning services. We want you and your family to be confident in the service we provide and be satisfied knowing you’re breathing the cleanest air possible! Thank you for the five star review!

name: Teresa Hauck, MEd HROD
text:
I called Kenny Gunnels of  Duct Cleaning Solution LLC in Smiths Station, AL to get help resolving a dust issue that was impacting my health. We had lots of dust particles circulating regularly through our HVAC system, which was making me cough and sneeze constantly and keeping my house very dusty. The  particles impacted my health causing upper respiratory infections, bronchitis and allergy headaches.

I was surprised to learn there was microbial growth in the ducts, so I also asked for the encapsulation process, which involves the application of a polymer coating sealant to the interior of insulated ductwork. The product Kenny used is designed specifically for use in HVAC ductwork and has anti-microbial properties to aid in the prevention of future microbial contamination.

I was so impressed With Kenny’s work ethic and diligence to ensure everything was done correctly. I’m currently working from home and there was minor noise and literally no disruption to my work day. I’m glad that I found a great professional to help resolve our issue with contaminants in our HVAC system,  The other thing that I loved about the service was that Kenny was a great communicator letting me know   when he was on his way, when he was here and when he was finished. He even sent text messages with pictures so that I can share them with my husband gets home from work!

I highly recommend Kenny Gunnels with Duct Cleaning Solution  LLC if you need to improve your air quality in your home!

Chris was able to fix the issue the same day he came out, and advised the AC had to much coolant. He leveled it out for me and we got a new filter, and cool air was immediate!

A day after the issue was resolved, a leak appeared in my garage and and I had to make another call. Logan came out this time and had to replace my condenser box. Issue fixed!! Both of these guys were great!! They were friendly, informative, and took great care of the issues for me in less than an hour when they were at the house. name: J K
text:
I needed to get my air conditioning system repaired.  So I called several HVAC companies, and I quickly found out that the repair cost was high enough that I was better off getting a new air conditioning system. So I did some research, and then I got quotes from 11 different companies. Of the price range of quotes, Xcalibur was among the lowest. So I chose Xcalibur, and the next morning, Ryan, Mark, Jacob and Zachary showed up and installed a new air conditioning system and furnace (I actually didn't need a new furnace, but the extra cost to add a new furnace to the a/c installation job was low.).  The installation guys were professional (for example, they put on shoe covers before entering my house) and knowledgeable.

I'm glad that I chose this company. First, Ben and Ryan are actually honest people. Also, Ben and his employees seem to take pride in doing a good job.  My new a/c system not only comes with the standard 10 year warranty for parts, but also a 10 year warranty for LABOR.  Call other HVAC companies yourself and ask if they include a 10 year labor warranty on a/c installations.  When they say no, ask them what the labor cost is to replace a compressor or an evaporator coil.  Also, Xcalibur installed new line sets with my a/c system. But some HVAC companies cut corners by not installing new line sets.

Since Alabama Power is my electricity company, I can track my electricity usage via Alabama Power's website or their app. My new Bryant a/c system uses about 39% less kilowatts than the American Standard system that it replaced.  In just the first month of using this Bryant a/c system, I saved over $100 on my Alabama Power bill!  I also found out that Bryant equipment and Carrier equipment come out of the same factories because they are sister companies.

If I could give Xcalibur 6 stars, I would. But Google only allows me to give 5 stars.

name: Tim Walker
text:
I always research before I make a big purchase.
My neighbor used Excalibur after getting 5 other quotes so I gave the owner a call. The whole team was friendly and professional. Other companies told me it would be weeks before they could get to me. I had a quote within hours of calling them and a full install in a few days. I really feel good about the work that was done, the product (Bryant) and the price I was quoted. Will definitely use them for future hvac service.

They explained was going to happen and got started. They worked diligently to get me fixed as quickly as possible and overall I would rate them as excellent and excellent experience for me . Ben Kayatta, who owns the company, has always made time to answer any questions that I have had, and even though I am sure that I am not one of their more significant customers, I have always been treated as if my business was just as important to them as anyone else's.  So that's five stars in my book!

name: Chad McHenry
text: Had a heat pump not cooling. Replaced 17 year old outdoor unit the very next day. Prompt and professional.

name: Kyle Schwab
text: I dealt with Emily (office), Brian (Manager), Nic (Sales), Layne (Service), Brian and Kenneth (Installers) on this job and it felt like I had the support from the entire company.  Everyone involved in my transaction was incredible and helped me answer all 10,000 questions and concerns I had.  (No way was I an easy customer on this one.). Everyone was incredibly responsive and always on time or even early.  I had a new 5 ton Trane system installed along with a electronic air Cleaning system with a UV lamp, ionizer, and electronic filter system.  Xcalibur was not the cheapest but also not the most expensive.  This team and product was worth every penny spent.  I highly recommend you letting them check out your needs.

name: Carla Jean Whitley
text:
I initially scheduled a dryer duct cleaning with another company. When the tech didn't show and the company couldn't tell me what happened, I hopped on Nextdoor for recommendations. Ben Kayatta and his team came highly recommended, so I submitted an appointment request through the website. This was on a Friday afternoon. By Saturday morning, I had an email from Ben that said he emailed, rather than called, to avoid disrupting my Saturday morning, but that he was available to schedule my service when I was ready. He made my appointment for Tuesday morning, only two business days later.

As promised, the technician, Zack, called before he headed my way. He arrived at the promised time and was just as efficient throughout the appointment. Zack showed me where my dryer duct ran to and explained what he was going to do. The vent hose on my machine was much longer than necessary, so he offered to trim it to reduce the possibility of it getting bunched up and causing additional issues. Zack was finished within an hour of his arrival and happy to answer my questions.

Xcalibur is fairly priced and competent. I will call Ben and his crew again.

name: Michelle Thompson
text: Nic was friendly and professional! Completed work in great time! He explained things on a level I understood and kept me appraised of the situation!

name: Matt Simmons
text: Nic was very professional and took the time to answer all of our questions. I would highly recommend him and Xcabur Services.

name: David Simmons
text: Excellent service, I am a customer for life now

resp.text: Thanks David,  It was our pleasure and an honor to be able to serve you.

name: Otis Bragg
text: My heat system ,was not working properly ...the technician check it and said I need a new unit ...the price the salesperson quoted was ridiculous high ask them if they had anything else .....

resp.text: Mr. Bragg,  I'm sorry you feel that way.  We always try to serve at the highest level.  I know I have personally spent about an hour on the phone with you trying to figure out a plan for us to move forward with your project.  It is my understanding that you haven't even received another quote for the scope of work you have requested.   I ask you to get a couple estimates from highly rated companies in the area.  I can assure you that was a good and fair price for the scope of work you were requesting.   At no time during any of our conversations did you ever share that we were not taking good care of you.  So I am a little shocked by your low rating.  In fact you stated that you really wanted to do business with us you just needed us to come down in price and i explained that we had come down as far as we could.  I am always available to talk to have my direct phone number.

name: Pamela Ware
text: Gave a time for 8 am and was there at 8am love the service I just love them  thanks for everything

He always calls to let me know he is on the way and when he does he even offers to bring me a coffee, soda or a snack on his way to my house. Nick represents represents Xcalibur well and I cannot say enough good things about him. Thanks again. Lord bless!
In Christ
Matt Aernie

name: Herbert Young
text: The price was extremely high.

resp.text:
Mr. Young, I am sorry that we weren't able to help you with your project this morning.  We are also sorry you didn't like the upfront pricing we provided.  We are fully licensed, insured, bonded, we are a well established full service contractor that offers 100% satisfaction guarantee along with 5 year warranty on all repairs.  We also know that our pricing is competitive if not lower than all of the other full service competitors in the area.  Please reach out to me at 205-718-8688. I would love to discuss further.
Ben-Owner, Xcalibur Services

text: Our air conditioner froze up. Ben came out same day and found a leak. We ended up having to get a new unit as ours was really old and needed to be replaced. text: Ben Kayatta and his team are clearly committed to honest and ethical service. You can count on them to give expert advice on what you ACTUALLY need and to follow through with it. I'd recommend them to anyone!

text: This company has been great with some of the apartment communities I help manage when it comes to water restoration and remediation. They are usually the quickest to respond, most diligent in getting me the information I need, and our rep is really great at advising us on how to move forward.

resp.text: Thank you Jennifer for your kind words! We are always striving to do better and be faster!

name: Brandi Todd
text: I've had several encounters with Servpro as a resident and employee at The Woodlands. Servpro was sent to take care of a leak in our apartment. They arrived very quickly to assess the damage and immediately started working to restore our apartment. The staff is fantastic, and they do a great job of handling all our emergencies here!

name: Heather Lanphere
text: Jake Wood is such a fantastic guy! Very professional and excited about his job!!!

resp.text:
Heather,

Thank you so much for your kind words. We think Jake is a pretty great guy ourselves! 😃 Give is a call for your next mitigation or reconstruction need!

name: Billy Jordan
text: Servpro was awesome. Came out quickly and got our crawl space dried within hours. Recommend them to anybody who needs something done right.

name: Heather McCormick
text:
Do not use this company whatever you do. I had my  rental house flood and it was the worst experience of my life using Serve Pro of Tuscaloosa.I had to call them 3-5 times to even go to the house to get the clean up  process started.Kept being told they was going out to start and when contractors went to give me estimates on repairs there would be no one at the house working on the clean up.They have lied to me several times about my property.Told me several different start and finish dates.They left drying fans in my house 7 days running after they had already cut the drywall and  insulation out. Drew one of the sales guys made up stories about the situation, told my tenant I had told him things when I hadn't even talked to the guy yet and told two different things ones to me and my tenant .I asked Drew why he did this and let him know I would be calling the office and  he proceeded to call my tenant a couple of times and send me a  6 page text over the situation which I found very unprofessional . When I called to complain about this Jacob the owners son took  up for the actions, was rude to me, did not listen to me and acted like I was bothering him.I was told my cabinets needed replaced when they did not. They pulled the vanity out of my master bathroom that did not need pulled out to begin with  without cutting the caulk and when they pulled the vanity it caused the mirror in the bathroom to fall on the sink shattering my mirror and busting my sink in the bathroom and tried to blame it on the heat in the room.I called  David the head of the construction department several times asking a start date and was told no repairs would be started  until they had 18 thousand upfront, Half the cost, and to ask my adjuster to call  his cooperate office and have Fed Ex deliver it to them.I asked my adjuster about it and he said that they did not that money upfront and was beyond shocked I had been told that.They still have their little lock box on my door a week after I told them I will not be using their services anymore, I have called four times to ask to have removed.I have called and asked  three times to speak to the owner of the franchise and got no response. The office staff is not friendly, they have horrible attitudes and make you feel  brushed off.  Brandy the girl in the office is very rude and  blows me off and acts like I'm a bother to her when I call to ask to speak to a manager or owner  . This is the most unprofessional company I have ever came into contact with in my life. And I strongly suggest people think  twice before using them for any reason. You will regret it if you  use this company, trust me on that.They thought since it was an insurance claim they would  take me for a run and rob me and  my insurance company blind and have caused me nothing  but a headache and  added stress from what happened to my home.

Chelsea
don't know how to reply to you  but this way. I too have a  job. Cant answer my phone if I'm busy.I have been trying to contact the owner since June 1st regarding all my issues when they first began.Have called several times .Today is June 20 and first attempt to be reached out to by the owner. You need  new office staff and employees that don't lie to customers and be extremely rude to them. I want my sink and my mirror replaced that was broken courtesy of your employees negligence. Thank you.

resp.text: Good morning Heather, I am deeply sorry you have not had a good experience talking with our staff. I have notified the owner, when we received your yelp review also. It looks like he tried to call about 9:00 am this morning. Please feel free to reach out at any time or email us at servpro8822@servprooftuscaloosa.com. The office has been directed to patch you through to him direct, if he is in during our office hours 8am-5:00 pm. I will follow up with him this afternoon to try and reach you again. I apologize for your less than ideal customer experience during this event in your home. The owner and I would be happy to work with you to figure out where communication errors started and how we can correct them in the future.  - Chelsea

name: Tammy
text:
They were all very sweet and helpful when they came out to our house for a house fire. But then everything got very confusing. We didn't know what was going to happen or when. Then they came in and packed all of our things up, first our clothes and no one told us to keep out any clothes. So we had no clothes blankets or pillows by the time they finished. There was 2 rooms that just had to be cleaned but they threw out our beds and furniture and took out all the carpet. We put notes on two closets and put don't enter.. I found the notes in the floor when we returned. They packed up everything and took it with them but nothing was cleaned it was just in the box they had packed it in.
They told us they we're going to clean the duck work, it was not cleaned, the ceiling fans were not cleaned nor were the blinds. We have had to just  about replace everything  we own plus we had use or own  money to eat at the hotel for   for over 2 months. Being nice is great but we had to many people telling us different things..it took a month after we got to come home before they started bring things back. It made difficult to cook. We had to buy new pots just fry an egg.
When they finally brought things back they were very confused about everything because the young guy and 3 woman that packed us up were fired. They didn't seem to know what was ours and what wasn't.  There are quite a few things missing.  Some of the items are antique and can't be replaced.  The thing is these items problem  went to someone else  and they just saw it was old and not there's. Maybe I need to go check the thrift store.  I didn't think this was going to be easy but this has been a nightmare. I have items that have tags on them, but they didn't take them or clean them. My blinds still have soot on them and it is not easy to clean. They we're supposed to clean and check or duct work , not even touched. And we saw the check our insurance sent them and that was way too much for this mess. This is the first time in 15 years we have made a claim on our house or auto  and now State Farm will not cover our house anymore. So we are going to have to sale our house and move because this put us in the red.

resp.text:
Tammy, I am so sorry for your bad experience with our crews. This is the first we have heard of any issue with your loss. We are trying to look into it internally, but would love for you to call the office at 553-8377 and let us know more so that we can get this issue resolved and make sure everything met to your satisfaction. - Chelsea

Tammy, Thank you for editing your review so that we may have a little insight on why you are unhappy with SERVPRO. I would like to also thank you for your kind words on our crews being "sweet and helpful." I can address that clothing and other textiles were cleaned by another company and not by SERVPRO of Tuscaloosa. We would like you to reach out to our General Manager and Owner at 205-553-8377 when you are comfortable and allow us to address and mend your concerns that we do have control over. Any issues between the claim and your insurance provider will have to be handled through their customer service, as our company does not have direct correlation between your insurance coverage. Again, we are sorry for the headache that was truly in control of our Franchise and the General Manager/Owner would, again, invite you to call and see how we can clear up confusion and give us the opportunity to fix what we are able to.

name: Christina Graham
text:
Please consider this review a PSA! Do NOT use this place. Perhaps if you are a corporate client, they will do well on your job. If you are individual customer, they likely will perform extremely poorly.

I was lied to on a couple of different occasions with my job, in particular about them contacting my insurance and the times that they did so. They typically arrived late (45 min to 1 hour) or on one occasion, they were so late that I was told to not even bother waiting. This was actually after being told by the person managing my job (supposedly managing it) that he thought they were finished up at my place. NOPE! Even after officially signing off that they were done, I brought in another mitigation company...and they are currently finishing the job that ServPro was hired to do.

There are major breaks in communication internally, as well as externally. I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy. Please don't use them and keep them in business any longer.

resp.text: Christina, this is deeply disturbing news to read. We did not know you had any concerns during your experience with SERVPRO of Tuscaloosa. Our office deeply apologizes for your additional distress in your experience with our crews. Residential claims are very important to us as well and we strive to do our best whether we are in a residential home or commercial business. We are very sorry you feel you did not receive our best. Our owners and management are actively investigating your claim file and you will hear from us directly with more questions and information soon. We want to make sure you are taken care of properly and wish that we had known throughout the job process that you were unhappy with the crew in your home.

name: Tully Corbett
text: Great people to work with.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We appreciate your business!

text: Our experience with Servpro was professional and efficient! We came home from church to a leak in our kitchen during the Christmas holidays. text: Servpro of Tuscaloosa is the quickest to respond to any type of restoration need you may have.  They're fast and friendly.  I've been in the insurance industry for over 20 years and never seen a more professional group than Servpro.  They will get the job done fast, and get it done right the first time. They do it all, fire, water damage, smoke, cleanup.   Call Justin or Chris 339-5022, they'll take care of you!!!!

name: Wes Graff
text: These people are basically crooks. I had an incident with a customer involving a drain line that leaked into the floor overnight and made a mess. I went out to see the damage myself before we called servpro out to clean it up. It was very minimal water on the floor. The only reason I didn't clean it up myself is because I didn't have a shop vac on my truck and thought it shouldn't cost more than a few hundred dollars to get it cleaned up, even though it was on the weekend, because there just honestly was very little that needed to be done. I was wrong. They charged me over a thousand dollars to do almost nothing besides vacuum up a small amount of water. Then on top of that they left their water bucket in the hallway over the weekend. It leaked water into the stairwell and ruined some of my clients ceiling tiles. When confronted about this Servpro management said that their bucket doesn't leak and that they were not going to replace the tiles. Please do not contact Servpro, they will take advantage of you on every turn.

name: LP
text: Professional Staff!  Very helpful and knowledgeable.

name: amy bentley
text: Can't say enough about the professionalism and service we received from ServPro in Tuscaloosa. Would highly recommend!

name: Thomas Billups
text:
My experience with Servpro of Tuscaloosa has been a nightmare for me and my family.
My 84 years old mother who suffers from Parkinson has been hurt more by Servpro of Tuscaloosa than by the tornado that damaged her home earlier in the year.
My parents used Servpro to store furniture and electronics in order to cleanup and rebuild after the tornado. Furniture stored with Servpro was returned broken, damaged and electronic items like televisions and a crystal chandelier are missing. Six months after they were paid by the insurance company and four months after returning the damaged items Servpro owner Don Elmore has yet to make things right. They are so eager to drum up new customers that they don’t service their current customers. Their customer service stinks.

name: J.R. Cunningham
text:
Worst experience of a lifetime. Lost valuable jewelry, broke a tv, scarred furniture. I asked for them to pay for the things. The answer from Kevin Driggers was, "Mr. Cunningham don't wait for a check from us, if we paid every complaint we'd go broke."
That is about the only true statement I heard from ServPro. They are not members of BBB.
The owner Don Elmore's final word to me were, "just sue me, sue me, I have insurance, sue me."
In my opinion I would never again allow my insurance  company to employ this business, nor could I recommend anything good about them.

text: The Serv Pro crew did an excellent job. They were professional and very courteous. Arrived on time and cleaned up when they finished. The entire experience was very good. I highly recommend them to anyone needing this type of service.

name: Dominique Vickers
text: Ms. Jennie is hands down the best! She walks you through every inch of the process to make sure you have a complete understanding. Very professional and hands on! Highly recommend!

name: Mark Strong
text: Let me start by saying that this is the first time IN MY LIFE that I’ve written a bad review about a business, so the fact I feel strongly enough about this matter to do so should say enough in and of itself. Based off my family’s (ongoing) experience to-date with Servpro of Montgomery, I cannot and would not recommend this business to anyone. Mr./Mrs. Brooks, I kindly ask that you or someone in charge reach out to me in a timely manner.  As a courtesy and to give you a chance to address the issue, I will refrain from posting detailed information of surrounding incidents and the lack of professionalism and timeliness your company has exhibited thus far.  If I do not hear from anyone in a timely manner I will have to share my story in order to help future people hopefully never have to deal with the same issue(s).

resp.text:
Hi, Mark, I am the General Manager, and I am terribly sorry to hear about your family’s experience. We try to maintain the highest standards of service, but clearly that is not what happened here. Please call me at 334-284-1612 at your convenience. I'd like to know what I can do to make things right. If you need anything else please let me know.

Thank you,
Kerry Brooks

name: Lashanda Gaines
text: The entire staff was helpful. There wasn’t a doubt that I wouldn’t be taken care of. They were swift, efficient and thorough during this time.

name: Linda Ross
text: The Servpro representatives worked tirelessly to locate all the water damage and begin the drying out process.  They were professional and friendly, always answering my questions explaining each step as they were worked.  I highly recommend them!

name: Kelsea Garrett
text:
I’m at a loss for words as I write this review, but am hopeful that what happened to our family doesn't happen to someone else.

My grandmother had a horrible fall that was devastating to her life. My  Dad trying to do everything he could in that moment to comfort family took a beautiful handmade silk pastel Turkish area rug to have cleaned.

With loss of family in that moment you don't think clearly especially when it's unexpected.  The rug was dropped off; there was no proof of receipt provided at the time.

The rug is no where to be found and because there was no receipt provided no proof we were told nothing can be done.

Being the price of the rug and sentimental value alone we hired an attorney to contact the store owner, and unfortunately were told there was no proof.

I hope nobody else ever has to have the same experience. Please be sure if dropping off a high ticket item regardless of the emotional state you may be in to get an exchange of a paper trail, the employee’s name, and would even add to take pictures. Beyond disappointed in how the owners have handeled this situation with no effort at all to make any attempt for a resolution.

resp.text: SERVPRO® of Montgomery is sorry to hear of the traumatic experience you and your family have suffered. Knowing what you have been through, it saddens us to know that you feel we have mishandled one of your family heirlooms. As stated in your review, there is no paperwork showing it was delivered to us for cleaning. We value our customers and enforce stringent protocols and procedures for any items entrusted to us. This helps to avoid any confusion or loss. I would like to personally investigate this matter but will need additional information to do so. Please contact our office at 334-284-1612 and ask for Kerry Brooks.

name: Cassie Spears
text: Wish I could give y'all 10 stars!! SUPER prompt, SUPER professional, efficient, effective, and just all around amazing! Ms. Jennie in the office, you have my sincerest thanks! Y'all dispatched an incredible team! God forbid I ever have to have a COVID cleaning again, but if I do, I know who to call!!

text: Very great company to hire !!!!!! They were clean and very professional during the whole process!!! Best you can get !!!

name: Dean S
text:
Do you own an older home? You might want to remove the built up dust in your heating/cooling ductwork.
ServPro is an expert cleaning service and the cost of duct cleaning is very reasonable.The technicians, Lamont and Shine showed up promptly at 9AM as scheduled and completed the cleaning in about 4 hours.
Now, the dust on the grilles is gone and air quality has improved. We are very pleased with this firm.Their technicians are thorough and professional.

name: Thomas Gaughran
text: Austin and Jon did an excellent job.

resp.text: Great to hear, we strive to please!

name: Linda Finney
text: The adjuster was very prompt coming to see damage. I was pleased and look forward to hearing start date.

name: Judy Van Luchene
text:
Several days after the house was empty, we stopped to see the progress...nothing.  For two weeks, we checked every
day, no workmen.  We were assured we would be back in by Christmas.  We went through three Project Managers, and
three different set of drywall and painters.  The first painting crew stood on my washer and dryer to paint the
ceiling in the laundry leaving dents and scratches.  We had stored the liquor from our bar in tubs in the garage,
as Servpro would not remove alcohol from the home.  Apparently the painters had found it and consumed a great deal
before they were removed from the job by Darin Ingle.  They also got paint all over our floors so Servpro brought
in commercial scrubbers which removed the finish on all of our floors.

To shorten this story, I will cut to the return home.  We finally returned to our home in early March with work still
going on, Painting and damaged floors. The first night home the water under the sink of my brand new cabinets
flooded the kitchen.  They had to send in dryers and a plumber who said it was not hooked up correctly and
reworked all of the kitchen dishwasher and sink plumbing. They sent in a professional flooring company  to assess
the floors. Their solution required us to move back into a hotel for at least a week so they could clean, reseal
the tile and recolor the grout.

The only thing that saved this project was Darin Ingle who arrived on the project in February.  Darin was sent in from another state to resolve the
problems at the Montgomery location that included our home.  Darin took the reins, brought in new crews and came
every day to ensure the work got back on track and that it was done correctly.  Darin's arrival was months into
the project and while we have never sued anyone, we were on the verge of doing just that to get another company
to come in so we could go home.  I am not sure if Servpro's executives realize that Darin not only saved our project,
saved them from a lawsuit but did an amazing job saving their reputation.  I would only call them again if Darin Ingle handled the job.
Because of Darin, I am giving Servpro a 2 star rating and Darin a 5.

An update to my review.  I was contacted by Mr. Bowen, an owner.  Mr. Bowen was determined to do something to do something for All we had been through.  He offered to send in a crew or something.  While his offer was appreciated, we had already fixed many of the issues and did not feel we could ensure another work crew I agreed to think it over and get back with him.  The one thing, as I explained to him, that distressed me everytime I went into the laundry was the dents and scratches on the tops of the washer and dryer which he eagerly agreed to replace.  With much of manufacturing shut down for long periods, appliances are in short supply.  However, Mr. Bowen and Darin Ingle were able to replace order And have new ones installed.  My frustration is no longer renewed when I walk into my laundry room.  My thanks to Mr. Bowen for reaching out and making this a better experience, and to Darin Ingle for making it happen.  It is good to know they cared to make things better.

resp.text:
Hi Judy, I am one of the owners and I am terribly sorry to hear about your experience. We try to maintain the highest standards of service, but clearly that is not what happened here. Please call me at 334-284-1612 at your convenience. I'd like to know what I can do to make things right. If you need anything else please let me know.

Thank you,
Bruce Bowen

name: Jon Cotton
text:
SOLID!!!!
Service Air has been servicing our two units since we've lived in Daphne (2015).  They came highly recommended after we had to dismiss another company for price gouging labor cost.  Recently they came to my house for service and pointed out some leaks during a bi-annual service and recommended I make a home warranty claim.  I made claim and a Home Warranty A/C contractor (not Service Air) came out and stated I needed new air handler and compressor.  Home Warranty A/C contractor (not Service Air) also tried to charge me a TON of uncovered cost. I contacted Service Air and reviewed my cost.  Service Air agreed to help me out for a entire new unit instead of piece by piece repairing my upstairs unit.  Along the way, Glen saved me money by explaining why I didn't need some systems, but would be better off with other.  All of Service Air's techs were highly professional and courteous.  Thanks a 2.5 ton to Service Air and all their techs for a great job.  I will be sticking with them and highly recommend them for your AC/H needs.

name: Gina Eudy
text: We had the worst experience ever with this company. We bought a new unit and it didn’t work as soon as the installers left. We called them back several times to correct the problem and it has been improperly installed the entire time! We had a huge water leak this past year and had to vacate our home for a month. The owner accepted full responsibility when he saw the air handler wasn’t even installed right. My insurance company had already been contacted at that point so they paid the claim minus our $1000 deductible. Now Service Air Eastern Shore have changed their minds and decided they weren’t going to accept liability anymore. So, we are out our deductible and our insurance premiums have already went up $1000 this year. Very disappointed with this company’s customer service and the unqualified installers.  They had an opportunity to do the right thing and didn’t.

resp.text: We replaced your old inside unit on 5-16-2016. At this time we recommended replacing your outside unit. You declined. On 3-23-2017 you had us replace your outside unit. Your system performed normally. On 5-30-2019, 3 years after the inside unit was installed, the drain line clogged up. Your other AC system, which sits adjacent to this system in the attic, had recently been replaced by another company. We found the drain lines had been disconnected. We corrected this problem and added two new safety switches to your drain and pan. Your insurance company contacted ours and had the event investigated. The insurance company determined that Service Air was not at fault. Your system was installed correctly and we never said otherwise.

text: We had not had much luck with HVAC contractors until we called Service Air Eastern Shore. We had a very large project that we thought might cost up to $1,000, but Glenn and Service Air figured out a way to do it for free. I am glad to know there are still honest and ethical people in the world. I will now always use Service Air and recommend them to everyone I meet.  You should try using them.

text: Initial AC install didn't work and leaked all over my attic floor.  At least the fact that it didn't work spared us downstairs ceiling damage from the leak. Don't be fooled by the $25 service call; they definitely make up any "savings" on their overall pricing.

resp.text: We are so sorry that you did not have an excellent experience with us!  We take pride in our work and rarely have issues like we had with you.  I will say that we always do what it takes to make any issues right.  We are upfront with our pricing and do not charge by the hour so the customer always knows what to expect ahead of time.  Again we apologize that we did not do our best with you.

name: Matthew Ashley
text: I've been using Scott with Affordable Heating and Cooling for years now. I use him to maintain my HVAC equipment at home and work. They have always been reliable and gotten us fixed up fast if ever an issue comes up. Recently my wife and I had them install the new Sensi Predict monitoring system on our unit at home. This unit was installed in a timely manner. The Sensi Predict allows myself and Affordable Heating and Cooling to monitor various items on my equipment. If anything gets out of line it will alert myself and Affordable Heating and Cooling that something isn't right with the unit. This will help keep small issues that are normally not seen until they cause bigger issues to be taken care of and extend the life of my older (14 year old) HVAC unit. I always recommend Affordable Heating and Cooling to anyone asking for service and support. Thanks again to Scott and his crew.

resp.text: Matt I'm glad you are enjoying the Sensi Predict and the 24/7 monitoring of your air conditioning system.  Thank you for being a long time friend of the Affordable Heating and Cooling team.

text: AH&C we're terrific!! Did exactly what they said they would do when they said they would do it. The staff was professional and I hardly knew they were in the house.

name: Casey Vinson
text: Called these folks the morning after my heat went out in the middle of the night. Explained that I have a disabled child in my home and needed someone to come out and get us up and running. The lady seemed really nice and symapathetic. After taking my name, number, address and email, she assured me someone would call me back in “just a little while” to schedule a time to come out. Never heard back from them at all. I understand if they were unable to help me out. My issue is the lack of communication. I placed several calls to several other companies. All of which at least tried to or told me if they could not help. Affordable Heating & Cooling is the only company that never bothered to call me back. Hats off to D ’n A Heating & Air for going out of their way to help us.

resp.text: We apologize that we missed your call Casey Vinson. Our staff has been working around the clock, so your call was directed to our answering service. We are sorry your call fell through the cracks. Looking over the notes from our answering service we have no recorded mention of a disability call, we try to prioritize no heat calls depending on the severity starting with young children and the elderly. As a company we aim to return calls to all our clients even if we cannot handle their issue to at least direct them to another solution. Once again we are sorry for not being able to return your call during this hectic time and are happy that you were able to solve your issue. Please accept a free maintenance check up on us.  If you would like text me(Scott) personally.  706-332-9880.

name: Brandy Kreisler
text: Scott did a great job.  He was very knowledgeable and dependable.  Our a/c was out on Friday night, but Scott came by and worked on the a/c until it worked.  That is excellent service!!

text: Excellent work and customer service! They got my house nice and cool again and I am so thankful! Definitely recommend Affordable Heating and Cooling!!

name: David Holt
text:
I have two 15 year old Trane heat pumps in my home. I am planning to completely renovate both systems in the next 12 months because I know that equipment like this only lasts 12 to 15 years, even when you keep it professionally maintained like we do.

Unfortunately, one of the compressors died and it makes no sense to repair it but I am not quite ready to invest in the new equipment just yet. I called Affordable and was told they could install a temporary cooling system to get us through the next few weeks while we get our renovation plans and money together.

In less than 4 hours, the Affordable team had the temporary cooling unit up and running! The house is already 3 degrees cooler and feeling great!

I really like that these guys look out for your safety, health, comfort, and lifetime efficiency.

Affordable for life!

Sorry for the trouble with getting a hold of us, but we have no messages on record, even with our answering service. We are not doubting that you tried to get in contact with us, just that it seems something caused all attempts to fail. I'm glad we were able to talk since this review and I hope the service we provided was to your satisfaction.

Here we are 4 days later... still waiting on that call.  If they were running behind and called, no big deal. But, to not show or call is not a good first impression.

Two hours later I finally called again and told me he will come next day at 9am. Well two days later no service, they never came, never called until I called back. They have no idea where their employee and they cannot reach him. Very unprofessional.

text: Great job!  I am very pleased with the dryer vent service that Jason and his team provided.  They were friendly, professional, and knowledgeable – and worked very quickly!  Highly recommend!

name: Ben Myers
text: I built a small garage and needed a Heat and Air unit for it.  I decided on a Mitsubishi mini split system and called about 5 dealers in my area.  Not only was Shane the most knowledgeable about them he by far had the best price.  He was very professional along with his staff.  Lyn was always pleasant to speak to when calling the office.  His crew was very fast and did a great job installing my unit.  I thought I needed a 18,000 BTU unit and Shane assured me that a 12,000 BTU unit would be sufficient. He was correct, this thing cools my garage in no time and is very quiet.  Knowing that I had a Mitsubishi Diamond dealer install my unit and getting a 12 year warranty gives me a great peace of mind.  My hat is off to Southeastern Mechanical Service.  I highly recommend them.

name: Isaiah Folds
text: he fixed my air conditioning for great price and good attitude. 👍👍👍👍👍 highly recommended using sms.

text: I would highly recommend SMS..Knowledgable & Friendly😊

They are the Mitsubishi mini split pros of the Tennessee Valley. You will be treated like the best customer and in service related work, that is hard to find. Real ¨Golden Rule¨ work ethics and genuinely nice people.

name: Jeremy Cannon
text: Great Service!!! Would give more than 5-stars if I could. Our technician, Joe, was very knowledgeable about both units that we have for our two story home in Decatur. He was very thorough in his diagnosis and changed the flame sensor that was in need of replacing. He checked every piece in our furnace, including the heat exchange pipes, to make sure everything else was in good working order. name: BlacKnight 1
text:
Great HVAC company! The owner, Shane, is very personable and the kind of guy you can trust with your door unlocked. Opie (dead ringer for a younger Ron Howard), his technician, is a relatively young guy (23), but mature beyond his years and a very good HVAC tech. He's also trustworthy and the kind of guy you would want to represent your company. Most importantly, he was able to diagnose my heat pump problem quickly and efficiently...10 to 15 minutes. The HVAC was over amped.

The company that installed my TRANE XL14 heat pump in 2007, Alabama Climate Control (ACC) of Huntsville, apparently did not notice that the heat pump was rated for max amperage of 40 amps because they did not bother to change the 50 amp circuit breaker in the panel in the garage. One would expect a professional HVAC company to do a basic electrical circuit check/test to ensure the electrical circuit is compatible with your NEW heat pump...right!?!?

Anyway, this oversight by ACC resulted in a fried circuit breaker in the junction box at the heat pump. Opie said we were lucky this situation did not result in a burned up motor or worse a burned down house. After all that, Opie tried to give me a $25 discount because I'm a veteran.

Thank you for the sentiment Opie, but also thank you for identifying a problem that has caused me great anguish over the years. I had to replace 3 or 4 compressors on the original heat pump (a Rheem) about 15 years ago when we first started renting out the house.

The HVAC company (same ACC) kept replacing all those compressors under warranty at $250 to $300 a pop for labor, but just couldn't figure out what was causing all those compressors to burn up (the same 50 amp circuit breaker in the breaker box). Then, I was dumb enough to hire them again to install a new TRANE in 2007. Remeber, the TRANE is rated for a maximum of 40 amps, but ACC left the same old 50 amp circuit breaker in the breaker panel. Voila...we get a fried junction box this time.

Incredible...that it took a young 23 year old tech with a lot less experience (but more common sense and intelligence) to recognize that a 50 amp circuit breaker is going to eventually cause some problems if it is not compatible with the rest of the circuit.

The cautionary tale here is...be extremely vigilant and careful about who you let work on your electrical systems and watch them like a hawk when they do...until you find a company like SMS that has techs like Opie.. Thank you SMS and Opie for saving my house from a potential fire.

text:
I called Lint Lizards because my dryer was taking a long time to complete cycles after we moved into a "new to us" house. As a precaution we decided to have our dryer vent cleaned because we didn't know how well the house had been taken care of and the laundry room is located in the center of the house rather than an external wall. It did not take Brad very long to discover the problem. A massive clog about 2 ft into the pipe which stopped his cleaning equipment dead in its tracks. After pulling the clog out  you could see that it was already starting to burn. We likely just saved this house from burning to the ground because of a clogged dryer vent! I recommend anyone that buy's or rents a preowned home to have this service done immediately. Our drying times were instantly improved and I'm waiting to see how our next power bill looks!

Brad with Lint Lizards showed up on time (early actually) and everything about his visit was professional and efficient. He explained everything he was doing in detail so I knew exactly what I was paying for. I highly recommend anyone considering having this done or whom is having issues with their dryer not drying clothes give Lint Lizards a try. It's a relatively cheap way of having some piece of mind that your home doesn't have an easily preventable fire hazard.

name: chris smith
text:
I did not know this business existed until I met the owner at lunch one day recently and asked him about his Company and what services they provided.   Once I found out that he worked on ductwork for downdraft stovetops and dryers I told him I had two jobs for him on Dauphin Island repairing the same.  Brad performed the work himself and could not have been anymore professional or knowledgeable.  He had exactly what he needed to move my dryer vent so that my new dryer would go all the way back to the wall and he also removed an enormous bird nest from our downdraft vent and had it working perfectly all for what I thought was a very fair price.  For anyone that has dryer vent issues or other duct work issues I would highly recommend Brads Company.  In addition, I mentioned to Brad that he should install the dryer vents in new homes so that he could match the vent location to the home owners dryer like he did on ours.  He was able to install a new dryer vent on he wall behind my dryer so that we no longer need an aggravating bunched up duct hose stuffed behind the dryer by installing the new duct coming out of the wall precisely so that when we push the dryer almost to the wall that it lines up perfectly with the duct on the back of our dryer.  Good job Brad!!!

Chris Smith

resp.text:
Chris,

Thank you for the opportunity and the kind review.
