name: RACHAEL
text:
I was supposed to have my refrigerator fixed today “ 03/23/2021.. My ice maker and water dispenser does not work... The 1st time the gentleman showed up on time to verify the temperature, model and what needed to be fixed and ordered.  I was okay with that the date was a week ago.  I called Service Care today because at this time I had not received confirmation to verify the time he was coming... There was no confirmation like email, text or no one had called to confirm.  I call the company today and Ms Chen states the parts “may” be in on the 25th of March and I explained to her that this was not explained to me she states the technician does not know when the items comes in I explained to her I don’t know his job of what information should or should not have been relayed to me I just know the date I was told the parts would be in and the date he will be back to fix it.
Of course, I requested to speak to the manager and of course the “MANAGER” is not here but I will relay the message!!!!

Please do not give a date you will fix appliances  if it can’t be done.....

IN THE FUTURE AT LEAST CALL THE CUSTOMER TO LET THEM KNOW THERE IS A DELAY OF DELIVERY OF ITEMS NEEDED SO THE CUSTOMER DOES NOT HAVE TO WAIT!!!!! STILL WAITING, NOT PLEASED AT ALL ... UNSATISFIED CUSTOMER!!!!!

I would not give this one star!!!!!

UPDATE ***03/26/2021**

I’m changing this from “1” STAR TO “4” STARS
The technician and a manager came to my home and apologized for the miscommunication... The part unfortunately would not fix my refrigerator “Ice maker and Water dispenser” because there is a shortage in the wiring and now I need a new refrigerator.  The technician was very professional, detailed in his explanation of why it did not work.  I will use SERVICE CARE again because even thou there was a “ball” dropped in the beginning they did follow up immediately and did not blame everyone else they took OWNERSHIP and that is what we are missing in these days and time....You made a uphappy customer a HAPPY CUSTOMER...

Thank you

resp.text: (Part not available from manufacturer, last one found in the counry, part arrived today, scheduled for today). I apologize, the part required to fix your water dispenser is no longer available from the manufacturer, however we have diligently pursued finding this part through other sources and found the last one available online. I'm sorry about the lack of communication regarding the difficulty of finding this part. We really expected this brand to support their products better with parts availibility. Tracking number 1Z3V582E0318781474 shows that your part was received at 11:42am, and we have confirmed the part is here and good, and our tech will be coming to you in 30 minutes or less!

name: Taliesha Cash
text: I really tried to give this company the benefit of the doubt but after the 4th visit to my house and no resolve  I'm done ..out of $350 and nothing works  my ice maker quit and it was working fine before they started trying to work on my freezer leak ..the freezer is still not closing after the drawer rod and hinges were replaced so that the door would close. it was closing fine and freezing before they touched it...At this point I count it all a lost and I guess I need a new refrigerator sure wish I could have used that $350 on a new one instead of wasting it on all these wasted visits to my house..save your coins and don't call them...

resp.text:
In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

This review was written before we refunded this customer. Sometimes a unit is too old, and has too many problems, to justify repair. We issued a refund after the customer decided to buy a new unit rather than approve further repairs. -- Initially we traced her leak to a clogged condensate drain, but she continued to have the leak. After the drain was found clogged again and cleared, it continued to leak. Further investigation found that that her drawer was not closing perfectly because of a defective gear, which was allowing moist room air into the freezer which was building up high levels of frost, which was also causing her drain to clog. When the unit defrosted, it would produce the leak called us about in the first visit. The rails to the drawer were also rusty, which interfered with proper drawer closure. In addition, she had a stuck light switch, which was unrelated to the leak problem.

In order to make up for a bad experience, we have offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

name: T N
text: I cannot recommend the Service Care team enough. They thoroughly earned their 5 Stars and exceeded every expectation of top notch customer service one could have. Toxey and his team did everything possible to help me find the part I needed, got it to me in a timely manner, and did so at an extremely fair cost. They put up with my 10k questions and let me pick their brain constantly on symptoms and what it might mean rather than selling me a bunch of parts that may or may not work. If you're looking for a team that will help you with your electronics and do so until the job is done, I would recommend you give them a call first. Thank you for all of your help.

resp.text:
Update: I look forward to hearing from you. Ask for Toxey at 205-956-3777. Thank you!

Wow! I’m so sorry, our hours have been changed for years, and I don’t know why the website wasn’t updated. If you’ll contact me Monday at 956-3777 I would like to hear about your experience and give you a credit towards your service for your wasted gas and time. My name is Toxey McDavid, and I am the owner. - update, I found a part sales page with Saturday hours listed. I’ve contacted our web developer and asked them to hunt these down and fix them. I hope that you’ll contact me and allow me to make this up to you. - Toxey

name: Lee Sharp
text: After waiting a week and a half for the repairman to come fix our LG refrigerator cooling issue, he came, claimed that our compressor needed replacing, and left. A week later, he came back to replace the compressor and fix the icemaker. He did and said it would cool in 24 hours. It did, so we put our food back in the refrigerator. THE NEXT MORNING, it was out again. All of our food was ruined. We had to call the actual LG repairman (which there is only ONE in the city of Birmingham). When he came, he had to AGAIN replace the compressor because the job before was so poor. He also had to replace another evaporator line because it was not working. The icemaker STILL does not work. This is STILL one of the worst experiences. After a month and a half, we finally have a cooling refrigerator, but still no icemaker.

resp.text: Lee, I'm the owner of Service Care and I apologize for your service experience. LG has more than one authorized service company, and I can assure you that we are one of them. I'm just unhappy that you're unhappy, and I would love to hear from you about your experience and do what I can to make it right for you. My company phone number is 205-956-3777, my name is Toxey McDavid, and I truly want to try to make this right.

resp.text: This review does not make any sense. -- We were paid by her extended warranty to provide service, and her extended warranty would not just abandon her to have to buy a new unit. This customer called to tell us it still had an issue after our repair (no mention of supposed damages at this time), we told her we would be happy to fix it, but she would have to call her extended warranty to send another dispatch. We never heard from them. -- Now we receive a review that implies we ruined her refrigerator and now has to buy a new one? -- This isn't how extended warranties work. We're very confused by this review, as we in no way damaged her refrigerator. We installed two parts, an icemaker and a damper... there's no way we could have damaged her unit, and no way her extended warranty would have told her she had to pay for a new unit (that's not how extended warranties work).

I can't see where we failed to provide follow up on this repair, and I'm sorry that we somehow created that perception.

resp.text: Hello, it sounds like the unit was not drying, and what was needed to repair that issue was a thorough dryer vent cleaning. If you compare prices with other companies that offer dryer vent cleaning, you will find that we are comparable or better in our pricing. We consider this a repair, as the unit was not functioning before we arrived, and after we spent time working on your issue the dryer was working again. I would love to discuss this with you further, please feel free to call our office at 956-3777 and ask for Toxey. I am very interested in hearing from you about what we could do to make this 5 star service. Thank you!

text:
Craig was a pleasure to have in our home.

Polite, professional, and pretty cool to deal with the unexpected situation that he walked into (squirrels in kitchen hood exhaust) with such a pleasant demeanor.

Highly recommended.

name: Scott Blanchard
text: When our Bosch in-wall microwave went on the blink, I contracted service care to do a fault diagnosis so that I could order the faulty part(s) and repair it. The technician misdiagnosed the problem as a blown fuse. Once I purchased a new fuse and replaced it (an extremely easy process), upon turning on the microwave the fuse immediately blew again. So, I was out my $85 diagnostic fee and still did not know the real issue. My first attempts to get Service Care to complete the diagnosis were unsuccessful, however, after some time, the service care owner called me and we reached a satisfactory agreement. For this reason, I would use Service Care again and can recommend them to others.

resp.text: Thank you Scott for your feedback about this experience, and for allowing us the chance to make it right. We appreciate you, and look forward to helping you in the future.

name: Ron Berry
text: Was professional and on time.  The tech knew exactly what to troubleshoot based on description of the problem.  I will use again.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ron! We're glad you were satisfied with your service.

name: Your name Your name
text: My LG refrigerator compressor went out. This is one of the companies LG forces you to use. Even with LG covering the expense of the compressor, about 350.00 the quote was 800.00 for then to spend 2-3 hours to repair.  The worst part was the tech told me it was a 50/50 chance it would last. The reason behind the ridiculous price, the tech explained that there was a strong possibility that multiple service calls would be made in the first year and they dont get paid for those, meaning the price hike was to help cover their possible future expense  The going rate from several other companies not affiliated with LG was approximately 400.00 to swap out the compressor, vacume to 5 microns and refill with r134.  Today, I am having another company come to my home and swapping the compressor to the non linear compressor, all paid out of my pocket, the entire job cost me 595.00. So how can it possibly be so much for the LG compressor swap if LG is covering the cost due to warranty? Another noteworthy mentioning is that I told the tech I would mount the compressor myself and would sweat on the copper connections myself, but that wouldn't change the price according to the tech. It's called price gouging and its pathetic. Be very cautious when dealing with this company, there are much better options out there, thankfully I found one, thanks Appliance Service LLC. A small locally owned business with an awesome response time (next day) and an affordable price. He also guarantees his work for a year, same as this one. No, I was not asked to mention his business, but who could resist when these other money bandits are out there preying on the unsuspecting.

resp.text: I appreciate you taking time to talk with me over the phone today about your issues. Your feedback is appreciated and helps us improve the customer experience. I understand where you are coming from, but we are an authorized warranty service provider for LG and we are not allowed to replace any part with a non-standard, experimental part. LG has an extensive process that they require in these repairs, in order to make the replacement compressors they provide function correctly in their units. These requirements add to the ordinary time it takes to repair these refrigerators, that may not be required when using parts that were not made for this unit. Unfortunately, as a warranty provider, our contract prohibits us from using non-standard parts to repair your refrigerator. If you will send us a proof of repair from the other servicer, including the parts used to repair the unit, I would appreciate it. I offered to refund your diagnostic, but did not realize that we did not collect it since we were unable to provide you with the service you desired.

name: Shaunda Kidd
text: Mr. Morgan was on time, and did a great job. Really appreciated his professionalism.

resp.text: Thank you! We're very proud of him, and glad to have him as part of Service Care's family. Happy to service Center Point and take care of your Whirlpool refrigerator.

name: KEVIN FOSHEE
text: Last summer when I had my dryer serviced I thought it was a little expensive, but they did a good job. Well it broke again... But to my disbelief, they honored the 1 year warranty and had the dryer fixed same day at no cost!

resp.text: Thank you! We offer a one year warranty on the services performed to show that we really, really, really stand behind our repairs. And we do! I'm glad we could take care of your Samsung Dryer and hope you don't have any more problems with it.

name: Bucky Wood
text: Very efficient and timely. Expert repair. I will use Service Care and Shay again!

resp.text: We're happy to hear about your positive experience with us, Bucky. Thank you for your review and your business!

name: Mark Rupright
text:
The power circuit of our five-year old LCD TV blew out and I called Service Care. Barry Beasley came out the next day and verified that it was the power circuit, found a capacitor that had blown, replaced it on the spot, and determined that the damage was more extensive. When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

Barry was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I plan to call on Service Care for other repairs in the future.

name: Catherine Cowden
text: I've known this family for years. My father was a technician with them years ago. Not only was it a wonderful place for him to work and support his family, when it came time for our family to be customers of this company, we were treated like members of their family.

resp.text: The Cowdens will always, always be family. Your dad is a lot of fun, has a good heart, and is one of the coolest guys I've ever known. It's a pleasure providing you with service.

name: Scents From Heaven
text: I am very pleased with the service ServiceCare provided. They were able to repair my washer in a timely manner and were very professional and courteous. I'm really glad I chose them for my repair needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, I'm glad that our service met (and hopefully exceeded) your expectations. It was our pleasure to help you with your washing machine repair!

name: Cindy Cuellar
text: I contacted Service Care in morning and they told me that one of their technicians would be contacting me soon.  The technician, Scott, contacted me 30 minutes later to let me know that he was on his way. Scott and another technician arrived and they were very pleasant and assured me that they would get to the root of the problem with my dryer not heating. Scott checked the fuses, heating element, thermal cutoff, etc. on my dryer and all were working. He determined that the dryer was not heating because the control board on the dryer needed to be replaced. He also recommended that I purchase a new dryer because my dryer was old and it would be much more expensive to replace the control  board and install it. I suspected this might be the end result, but I felt it was best to have the experts make that determination. Despite the fact that I have to purchase another dryer, I was very pleased with the promptness, knowledge and professionalism of Scott and the other technician that came with him, and because of this experience, I will be contacting Service Care in the future if I ever need service on my appliances or television sets. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: We're very proud of the care our technicians show when they come to your home. Scott and Greg are two genuinely good people, that live up to the "Care" in our company name. Proud to have them represent us!

name: teresa spencer
text: Cliff was very friendly and knowledgeable about his job. He’s the best.

resp.text: We're very proud to have Cliff serving all the neighborhoods in 35217, and so glad we could take care of your refrigerator the same day!

name: Patricia Noffsinger
text:
Requested a dryer repair from this service and was very pleased with the overall professionalism and customer service. When the technician came to evaluate my abnormally noisy dryer I was quoted and shown an invoice for parts/labor totaling over $560. I reluctantly chose to have my dryer repaired because buying a new dryer would cost several hundred more dollars. I was also required to pay half of the service fee before Service Care would come out to complete the repair—I assumed so that the very expensive parts could be ordered. When *my technician arrived I was surprised to see him carrying a very small bag of parts and was finished with the repair in less than 30 mins—I was expecting a little bit more for a repair costing well over $500 dollars. Come to find out when I researched the actual cost of parts I found out the parts cost around $35 which means service care charged me nearly 1000k an hr for labor. Please do not use this company. A total scam. Buy the parts yourself, watch a  tutorial YouTube video, and save yourself literally HUNDREDS of dollars.

Heard back from customer service. Per their customer service rep my technician mistakenly charged me for the parts 4 times resulting in a quote that was over $200 dollars more than what it should have been. The invoice I received from the tech clearly states that only one was ordered for a parts/installation fee of $560.11 which alerted my spider sense. Customer service offered me an ultimatum of either $200+ refund because of tech’s alleged mistake (meaning I still paid over $300 dollars to replace a $35 dollar part that took 30 mins to replace) or they would come out to take out the $35 part for a full refund. Despite having been charged a fee of $80+ for an in-home quote which by their own admission was inaccurate they refused to refund that. I only agreed to the repair because based on the description of what needed to be done to repair the unit seemed extensive and beyond my skill set. If I didn’t have to take another day off wrk (on top of the 2 I already had to for the quote and the repair) for them to come out to take back what they put in I would have gladly had them come out and take it out. Found a step by step tutorial video on YouTube and the repair is actually quite simple.

Service Care this type of business practice is shameful to charge such ridiculous amounts of money for simple repairs. This is flat out fraudulent and predatory. Their excuse for such high pricing basically boils down to “We use nationally recognized software to provide quotes...” Translation: We do it because we CAN. Not because it’s RIGHT. They knowingly charge SEVERAL hundred dollars an hr for labor for relatively simple repairs. Buyer beware and be sure to do your research first. This repair could have been easily DIY and done for $35 bucks in parts and a Phillips head screwdriver.

The owner himself discourages buying parts off Amazon in his response but the Service Care website  actually contains a link that customers can use to buy “cheap” OEM replacement parts...from Amazon. :l
Again, a total scam, folks. Stay clear of this place.  Had I not questioned my order I would have been duped.  This is supposed to be a repair that the company does “hundreds” of times but no one from company realized I was over charged by several hundred dollars (not a few dollars but several HUNDRED dollars) until I said something about it. Had I went to Publix to buy a gallon of milk and it rang up for $50, the cashier would have instantly thought, “Huh...it’s usually $3.99. Something must be wrong.” Not Service Care. They will take your money and run without thinking twice about it. They still refuse to refund my in-home quote fee for a quote that was inaccurate.

*Technician’s name removed from review at the request of the owner

resp.text: Hi, I'm sorry you were so unhappy with your experience, and I can see why. The technician made a technical error while building your quote. Instead of quoting for a pack of 4 rollers, he quoted for four 4-packs of rollers. The pricing software that we use thought we were replacing those parts 4 times, which increased the quote. (We would be happy to send you a copy of the original quote, which included the 4 rollers, not one). I feel certain that we would have caught that during our billing process, but we appreciate you calling us so soon after your repair to let us know. We're issuing you a refund for the difference. We stand behind our repairs with a one-year warranty which requires us to use OEM manufacturer parts which are usually more expensive than the cheap ones you find on Amazon. Of course, most of the cost of any repair, from any company, is the labor and skill that it takes to diagnose the problem correctly and replace it in a timely manner. I appreciate the feedback! Good and bad helps us to continuously grow and improve as a company. Listening to our customers has been a huge reason we have been a family and locally owned business for well over 30 years.

name: Anthony Marino
text: Ask questions about ladder work but still charge for service call

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you were not completely satisfied with your service. However, we base all of our prices off the Major Appliance Service National Price Guide. By using this guide, we ensure that our customers are getting the best possible repair price for their dollar, considering all the factors that go into providing excellent service.

name: Cindy Cuellar
text: I contacted Service Care in morning and they told me that one of their technicians would be contacting me soon.  The technician, Scott, contacted me 30 minutes later to let me know that he was on his way. Scott and another technician arrived and they were very pleasant and assured me that they would get to the root of the problem with my dryer not heating. Scott checked the fuses, heating element, thermal cutoff, etc. on my dryer and all were working. He determined that the dryer was not heating because the control board on the dryer needed to be replaced. He also recommended that I purchase a new dryer because my dryer was old and it would be much more expensive to replace the control  board and install it. I suspected this might be the end result, but I felt it was best to have the experts make that determination. Despite the fact that I have to purchase another dryer, I was very pleased with the promptness, knowledge and professionalism of Scott and the other technician that came with him, and because of this experience, I will be contacting Service Care in the future if I ever need service on my appliances or television sets. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: We're very proud of the care our technicians show when they come to your home. Scott and Greg are two genuinely good people, that live up to the "Care" in our company name. Proud to have them represent us!

name: Rhonda Cole
text: Brian is always very courteous and proficient. Katy, in the office, is on top of things.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback on Brain and Katie, they are excellent employees! We appreciate your business, Rhonda.

name: Lindsay Hewitt
text: They were not able to fix the problem I was having with my stove due to the parts being discontinued, which was fine by itself. I had six burners that were clicking nonstop but the problem was only with two.  The tech that came out was able to make them stop clicking and told me I would just have to use the other four burners but then he undid fixing the burners before he left so I had to fix it myself after he left.

resp.text: *Parts no longer available* -- Thank you for the feedback. I can understand your disappointment that the parts that were no longer available for your repair. I spoke with our technician, and he did not mean to "unfix" your burners. When he demonstrated to your husband that they were working, he tells me he honestly thought that they were functioning properly. I'm glad you are able to use the four remaining burners, and I'm terribly sorry that the parts were not available.

name: Mark Rupright
text:
The power circuit of our five-year old LCD TV blew out and I called Service Care. Barry Beasley came out the next day and verified that it was the power circuit, found a capacitor that had blown, replaced it on the spot, and determined that the damage was more extensive. When he looked up the price of the replacement part, we decided it was more convenient to buy a new TV. He didn't even charge us for the attempt to fix the problem, only the service call!

Barry was very friendly, helpful, and professional. I plan to call on Service Care for other repairs in the future.

name: David Ball
text:
The technician that came out and serviced my dryer was great.  He figured out what the problem was and fixed it withouit any issues.

I plan to use them again for some other appliance repairs that I have coming up

resp.text: That's awesome, we're glad to help with your Maytag Dryer. We proudly provide service to our Heatherwood neighbors in Hoover.

name: Kiwi Superbo
text: Curtis was a sharp,professional and personable service technician. I watched him work on multiple appliances with excellent attention to detail.He was relentless in scoping out and fixing the problem. I trust him to work on any of our future needs.

name: Nancy Borkowski
text: Scott was on time and very professional. I will definitely use Service Care again!

name: Timika Kelly

text: I have used Service Care several times and have been very pleased with their service. The people are very kind and they are experienced with the upper end appliances and how to fix them.

text: We have nothing but good things to say about Craig Raney.  He is always prompt and professional.  We wish all service people would be so personable, friendly and helpful.

name: Lynn Holder
text: The service technician Cliff was very nice and professional. He installed a part on my washer and took time to make sure that I understood everything.

name: Kim Brittle
text: Disappointing experience.  I called for a washer and dishwasher repair.  They could not get a technician out for over a week.  I called another local service who could have someone out the next day.  Once I knew the repair needed (motor replacement), I called them back to ask an approximate price if they indeed diagnosed the same repair when they came.  Russ, who answered the phone, was rude and dismissive.  When I asked my question he said "I don't even work on them so I have no idea on that" rather than trying to refer me to someone who would?  After his response I said well I guess I need to cancel the service call I requested and after asking my number said "yep - you're cancelled".  He did not try to earn my business and made it clear he had plenty of customers and no time for one that dared to ask a question.  Unfortunate, but not someone I would trust with a $400-500 repair, if they are unwilling to answer my question or even try to earn my business.

resp.text: Hi Kim, It's our policy to not provide estimates over the phone, whether it's based on the diagnosis of another company or not. I really feel that our customer service representative could have done a much, much better job communicating with you and helping you to understand why we don't do this, and I apologize for the experience you had.

name: Gail Hide
text: Excellent service!! Will definitely use again and recommend! Scott was very professional and knowledgable!

resp.text: Thank you! We're proud of Scott and glad we gave you 5 star service.

name: Mike Natter
text: Doug did a great job in servicing the cook top

resp.text: Thank you! We're proud of Doug, and his massive experience with cooking products. We love Hoover customers and we take great pride in taking care of your Jenn-Air cooktop.

name: Patricia K Martin
text:
The tech called before he came and was excellent. Barry was polite, amiable, and extremely knowledgable .
Resolved the issue quickly and explained the process.

name: Joe Stephens
text:
Tech provided an inflated quote including a part that was not broken.  Also told me it would be at least a week before they could get the parts.

That night, I followed the troubleshooting steps in the manual, and was quickly able to identify the broken part.  He would have also if he'd bothered to use a voltage meter.  Bought the part locally the next day and completed the repair.

Looking back, it was clear he just wanted to collect the service fee and leave.  Would not recommend!

resp.text: ** Cannot find this customer in our system ** --- Although I am terribly sorry you had a bad service experience, I can not find a service call with your first and last name within the past 5 years. --- I've also looked for any calls with your last name in the last 6 months and none of them matched what you described. --- If you received bad service from one of my technicians, I want to know about it and I want to make it right... but I can't find you. Please call 956-3777 and ask for Toxey McDavid (owner) so that I can take care of you. I'm determined to fix this.

name: JULIA BELL

Service Care, Inc. did for me in two visits what my home warranty provider could not do in a month, that was repair my dryer.
A tech by the name of Scott came into my
and immediately diagnosed and remedied
my problem. Scott was professional and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you Julia, glad we could help. We're proud to have Scott in our Service Care family, and glad he does a great job taking care of customers.

text: I HAVE ALWAYS BEEN HAPPY WITH SERVICE CARE. THAT'S WHY I CONTINUE TO USE THEM. AND I AM VERY PARTICULAR. KEEP IT UP.

name: Marvin Brokaw
text: I was very pleased with the knowledge, work and results from ServiceCare. Eddie, the technician, diagnosed the problem with my clothes washer quickly, contacted the manufacturer and had the part ordered before he left. He returned the next day and installed it.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words about Eddie and your experience. We aim for 5 star service, and glad we delivered!

name: Tuan Anh Le
text: Mr  toxey reached out to me and we both had a detailed conversation. I am very appreciative that he did that and for that ive become a loyal customer.....very very good customer service....

resp.text: Hi, I'm Toxey McDavid and I'm the owner of Service Care. Please call me at 205-956-3777 so that we can discuss your repair experience. I looked into your repair and checked on the pricing. Our technician charged almost $30 dollars less than the price quoted in our blue-book pricing guide. (This is the guide used by 1000s of appliance repair technicians to price repairs). I also could not find that part for $9 on Amazon. This is a full heater assembly replacement part that includes the heater element, heater housing, and two replacement thermostats and can not be found on Amazon that cheaply. We never use "knock off" discounted parts, only original manufacturer replacement parts. Most of repair costs are actually for labor and diagnosis, and the total time of that process was a good deal more than 15 minutes by our records. I hope to hear from you soon, I want you to be happy with Service Care. Thank you!

name: John Johnson
text:
Wish I could give less than 1 star.  I was told the repairman would be here between 8 and 12, I called at 12:15 to ask about the status of the tech.  I was told that he would not be coming because I never returned a confirmation call.

When I questioned them about the confirmation call I was told they called on three separate occasions.  I had no messages on my machine and no missed calls from their number.  When I told them that fact, they became argumentative about the calls rather than finding a way to resolve the issue.

I would run as fast and as far away from this company as possible.  If you are using this company because you called Lowe's customer service then I would ask the customer rep for another service company.  If you called this company because you found them on the internet then hang up the phone vector they answer.

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I have apologized to this customer for his bad experience, and offered him $85 towards the next appliance or television repair. Whether we had called him and left messages or not, he had an expectation of service on that day and we didn't deliver. We've taken steps so that will never happen again.

name: Danielle Rose Hesley
text: Very thoughtful and knowledgable.

name: Lucinda Harmon
text: Horrible service. Overpriced for the work I had done. Technician that worked on my microwave didn't know how to even turn it on and didn't seem to know what he was doing nor did anyone who answered when I called. I will NEVER us them again. -5 stars!

name: Vicki Anderson

name: Samantha Gardner
text: These folks noto only had my part, they removed the old heating element from the casing and put the new one in free of charge. They also entertained my three year old and were super sweet!

resp.text: Thank you! -- It was a great pleasure to meet you and your daughter, and glad that your daughter gave her name to our office "jaguar". :)  We're happy to help!

name: Eric Smith
text:
I had a 65" Plasma TV which all HDMI inputs stopped working. I called and I spoke to Russ. I asked for someone to come out to look. After I told them my location I was told it would be $85 to inspect, but if they did repairs it would be subtracted from the labor cost. My TV was expensive so I was willing to accept the risk that it wouldn't be fixed.  and I gave him the model number. The technician called and we arranged a time and he was there in a reasonable amount of time. He asked what the problem was and I explained again that all HDMI ports were not working. He then went to search for a mainboard replacement for the TV. He couldn't find one.

I'm giving them three stars because there was sufficient information given to them to be able to tell me over the phone that they wouldn't be able to find a replacement part. I explained my frustration to the technician. He said that they mostly deal with appliances and he'd never been unable to replace a main board for a somewhat new Panasonic (< 5 years) and that he wouldn't have time to train the staff to get all pertinent information. To me, that's a training issue.

Polite and responsive people, but they need to do better with the information that they are given. They had the part number and the description of the problem. I could have sent them a picture of the back of the TV since that's all the technician needed to see.

resp.text: *We will apply the diagnostic you paid to a future repair* --- I'm sorry that a TV this new is not being supported by the manufacturer. We were as surprised as you were that these basic parts were not available. We will do our best to screen these in the future. I will happily apply the diagnostic fee you paid to a future service call.

name: Bud Pommer
text: We have rental property in the Birmingham area. We live on the Gulf Coast and can not check on things unless we ride 4 hours each way. Service Care Inc. has been there to fix our Maytag washer and just recently the Maytag Dryer. this last service call my wife was in the hospital for surgery when complications occured that were life threatning. I was able to give all my attention to my wife's needs as once again Service Care handled our appliance problem in Birmingham. My thanks goes out to this company! God Bless!

name: Nadine Brown
text: The technician, Benjamin S. phone me ahead to say he was 20 min away, showed up on time, replaced windshield in an hour at my worksite, and was very thorough with post install information.  I would highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Nadine for the good review, but we don't install windshields. We're Service Care, a TV and appliance repair company for Alabama customers. I'm glad you received good service though. :)

name: Leslie Ellis
text: Extremely professional in appearance and action. Quickly repaired my freezer and were very courteous!

resp.text: Thank you! It's great to hear from you, and we look forward to helping you again whenever needed.

name: Brooke Beckham
text: Service Care is always available, professional and great with follow up. They have provided service for our washer, dryer and refrigerator.

name: Kelly Duke
text: Service care came out and fixed our washer- knew exactly what was wrong immediately. I was initially unhappy with some interactions that I had with the technician, however it was taken care of immediately by the owner, which I think shows a strong commitment to customer service.

resp.text:
Kelly,

I hope you have received my phone call and email response to this review. I absolutely condemn this sort of behavior, and will be taking actions to correct this. If you could contact me at the office at 956-3777, and ask for Toxey McDavid, I want to know about your experience. This will not happen again, I can assure you. I look forward to hearing from you.

name: jane long
text:
It has been one week since Service Care was contacted to repair my Maytag ref/freezer.  They came the second day, now I am waiting, waiting, waiting.....
Communication is terrible.  Technician said we would hear from their parts department in 3-4 hours.  Phone calls to them not very productive did find out a part was ordered 3 days after the technician was at my house.  Really?  3 days and no one can say when they will be back.

resp.text:
I apologize for the negative experience you had with this technician. He is no longer with Service Care.

We never want you to be treated this poorly, and we will not allow someone who works for us to do it either.

Toxey McDavid
Service Care, Inc.

text: Worked with Bosch to fix our new dishwasher that was delivered damaged.

resp.text: We're glad we could repair your Bosch dishwasher, Mike. Please let us know if you need anything else.

text: It took over two months to have my television fixed and after paying $60.00 all I got was wasted time. I repeatedly called and was put off. My technician didn't want to be bothered talking to me about the progress on my television. I ended up coming to pick up my television 2 1/2 months later and having to ship it somewhere else. It was clear that they weren't at all concerned about customer service.

resp.text:
I've already responded to this before, but Google seems to have lost all my responses:

Mrs. Mobley and I have spoken, and her problem was resolved. I refunded her $60, and we had a great conversation. She's a true professional, and I wish her the best with her business.

name: Scott Scroggins

name: Paulette Givhan

name: Al Simmons

name: Jroy N
text:
They were on time,friendly, and efficient
Thanks for a great job well done!

name: Joseph Beckham
text: I felt the service was excellent from the order to the tech, who was considerate & professional.

resp.text: Thank you! We're proud of Eddie and our customer service staff. It was our pleasure to serve you.

name: Pamela Gasink
text: We had 2 appliances with issues: a 7 month old GE Profile telescoping downdraft vent (not raising and lowering smoothly) and a Kitchenaid Architect Series dishwasher (leaking water).  The technician, Craig Harris, was professional, personable and most importantly knowledgeable.  After inspecting the downdraft and learning how new it was, he got on the phone with the GE Customer Care Team and they took over the resolution since the product was covered under warranty (in a previous call that I made to GE... they blew me off with the reply that the unit must not have been installed properly... which it was).  That situation was resolved with a swap of the defective GE downdraft.  Craig then diagnosed the DW problem as a broken soap dispenser that was surprisingly allowing the high pressure water to get into a small hole and leak down through the front panel and out to the corners and then onto my floor.  A 2nd visit was required to allow time for the part to be ordered (expensive little plastic booger).  I was very pleased that the very same person was sent for the installation, this rarely seems to happen with most companies. He was very careful not to scratch any outside components or my hardwood kitchen floors.  He was a quick with his work and above all, an expert.

name: thegary clark
text: had an email conformation on a service date, took 1/2 day off to cover the 12-5 service window. No one showed up so I called and was told I had changed the service date. Who the hell does that?

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

Hi, I'm sorry you had this experience. The first service call for the dryer was submitted via our online portal on August 18th at 10pm for a Frigidaire dryer, and scheduled for August 23rd. -- First thing Monday morning, we left a message for the customer to call us to verify the address (and so we could explain what will happen during service visit). -- 10 minutes later, we received a call back and were told that there was another dryer, a Samsung, and would also like that one to be serviced at the same time. A ticket was created at that time, and both were scheduled for the 24th. (Probably because it was now two calls, not just one). -- The initial email confirming the service call would have been sent Friday after the one unit was scheduled online, which is I think the source of the confusion. I'm not sure why the system did not send a followup email with the new information, and I apologize deeply for that. -- We wouldn't claim that the customer called and changed the service date unless we had received a call from someone, and we certainly wouldn't have created a new ticket for this customer unless we had communicated with someone. That just wouldn't make sense for us to do that. -- We're terribly sorry that the experience was confusing, and that you spent time waiting for a call that never came. We take great care to meet and exceed customer expectations, and we will examine our processes in detail to see what could be improved so that this does not happen again.

name: jennifer campbe
text: Great job. Thorough and quick service.

resp.text: Thank you! It was our pleasure serving you.

name: soscout1
text: we called on Friday  but was too close to closing time to have anyone come out, so they made an appointment  to come out on Sat between 9 & 1  to check out our frig.   we CANCELED  a trip to be here and no one ever showed up or called to say they were running later or not going to be able to come !!   HOW UNPROFESSIONAL !!!

resp.text:
We offered this customer a free deluxe home appliance maintenance service call, which includes safety and preventative issue maintenance on their refrigerator, washer, dryer, dryer vent, dishwasher and oven (a $299 value).

I truly wish I could give a better response to this review, but since I have no customer information to look up this service, I really can't.

If a call was scheduled Friday night for Saturday morning after our technician's paperwork was printed out, it's possible that this could happen. If we had a telephone number wrong, it's possible also that we would not make it out to your home. But I am just guessing without knowing more about you.

I would love to hear from you via our email address ( service@servicecare.net ) with information about this, so that I can make sure this doesn't happen again. This is not  how we treat our customers.

Thank you,

Toxey McDavid
Service Care, Inc.

text: Our technician Craig did an excellent job in fixing our problem. We were very pleased and I highly recommend him.

name: Vicki Quick
text: We have used Service Care for a couple of repairs in-store and a couple on-site.  All instances have been handled promptly, courteously, and professionally.

resp.text: Hello Vicki, thank you for the five star rating. It's always been a pleasure working for you, and we hope to be helping you for many years to come. I'm glad that refrigerator is still working great!

name: Rick Larimer
text: Very knowledgeable. Would ask for Scott next time.

resp.text: Thank you, Scott is great, we're proud to have him.

name: Scott Fortenberry
text: On time for appointment. Courteous repair person. Expensive estimate

resp.text:
Thank you for the review Scott, but I'm confused.

The last repair we show for any with your name was for two Panasonic 50" TVs, and the repairs were covered by warranty (so our estimate couldn't have been expensive, at least not for you.) Both of these repairs occurred in September of 2009.

Can you provide me with your invoice # at service@servicecare.net ? I would like to look into this, but unless the repair was under a different name, I think you have Service Care confused with a different servicer.

name: Katherine Allen
text: Service Care is the best!  6 month guarantee on all work...you can't beat that! A+++++++++

name: Dominique Linchet
text: As always, Service Care repairman was punctual and repaired our appliance.

name: shalandia nelson
text: Clifton very professional and clean and he explained my problem to me after he got finish with diagnostic he told me how much it would cost to fix it

name: Mike & Stephanie Freeman
text:
We first called the company “Critter Capture” and had them come out to get rid of a squirrel that had made his nest in our gutter. After checking our attic and seeing that the squirrel had not yet made an entrance into our house, they told us there was nothing they could do.  The guy didn’t even have a ladder to check our gutters!

So we call Jim from Exclusive Wildlife & Pest Control.  He laughed when I told him the previous encounter with the Critter Capture company and then proceeded to get his ladder (that he brought himself!) and take a look at our gutters and ensure that the squirrel had not damaged our roof yet and also took the time to double check our attic. No damage was noted except for the fire pit cover we caught the squirrel tearing up the previous weekend.

Jim gave me two options on how to get rid of our furry new houseguest; we could capture him alive and release him elsewhere or set a trap similar to a rat trap that should kill him instantly. After much discussion my husband and I decided on the rat trap since the evenings here have been very cold and the poor squirrel may freeze to death in a live trap. Jim was so very patient as we weighed our options and was able to give me the pros and cons on both methods.

After one failed attempt to trap him (the trap caught his tail instead of his neck) Jim text me throughout the evening to reassure me that he would get him the next day and that all would be OK. Jim returned promptly the next morning, set the trap again and was able to get the squirrel instantly. He disposed of everything and cleaned the nest out of the gutter.

Jim was so very pleasant to work with I will definitely be calling again if any other squirrel decides to make his home here!
I would recommend Jim and Exclusive Wildlife to anyone who is looking for good, quality, and prompt service.

Thank you Jim!

resp.text: Thank you Mike & Stephanie Freeman, it was my pleasure helping you rid your home of your unwelcomed guest and it was nice meeting you.

name: Nancy Owen
text: All I can say is Autumn Air was professional, trustworthy, economical and exceeded all my expectations. There is nothing more aggravating than to have your air conditioning unit quit. Although it is mid-October we needed our air conditioning fixed ASAP. Our unit was 17 years old and I knew we needed to replace it if not immediately, within the very near future. I emailed a few companies Saturday night asking for estimates and to please contact me Monday morning. Only Autumn Air and one other company returned my call today. Autumn Air was very pleasant and offered to have someone come out to price the unit immediately. Since I knew I did not want to start throwing money away repairing such an old unit I asked for a quote for a new unit (with and without the furnace). Skip came out and priced the unit with three options and it was clear if I wanted more options he would give them to me. He did not acted putout or frustrated with my request. He did not pressure me to make a decision nor did he push me to buy the most expensive product. Without me asking, he let me know the specials that were being offered. I asked how soon they could install the unit and he said either this afternoon or in the morning. I called my husband and sent him the estimates. My husband was impressed and even showed his fellow employees who were also impressed with the prices. After weighing the pros and cons we decided to replace the entire unit (with furnace). I called Skip back about 2:30 saying we did want to go ahead and replace the unit, he said he would call me right back, that it would be either this afternoon or in the morning. I was floored when he called me back shortly afterwards and asked if it was okay with me if they could install it today. Skip and two other gentlemen came and installed the unit working hard until close to 9:00 pm. We were all extremely grateful to the diligence of these men. In addition, Autumn Air included a 2-year service plan where they will come out to service/clean the unit twice a year. They have earned my trust. I am very thankful to Autumn Air.

resp.text: Thank you!!!!

name: John Hosmer
text:
For a long while there have been atmosphere issues in our basement where the previous home owners had never taken care of sealing up the rooms and keeping temps and humidity in check. We had addressed those issues and we had tried using good filters at the returns to prevent as much of any dust, mold spores, etc. from recirculating and spreading, but it ended up being a losing battle for both comfort and our family's health.  Finally, about a month ago I disconnected one of the flexpipes at the end of the trunk run to see just how bad it was and found almost 100% coverage of dust, mold, and nastiness throughout the system. It was in every bit of the trunk, and every flexpipe throughout the house (See pictures). Even a few of the vent registers had started harboring mold growth which was a really bad sign as well.

So, I did what any good panicking homeowner would do at that point. Went to Google, pulled up nearby HVAC companies with good reviews that could do duct replacement, and called for appointments for onsite inspections. Out of the four highly reviewed and reputable companies (minus individual contractors) in the Pelham area that actually showed up for their appointment, Autumn Air's rep Baker was the only one who showed up on time, actually visually inspected inside the ductwork even after I showed him the initial pictures I took, and then spent a solid amount of time explaining to me options for replacing the entire ductwork system so we could see about what would be right for our budget. In the end, the price that Autumn Air was able to provide for an upgrade to a new round smooth metal interior and outside insulated wrapped system, including new boots and registers, throughout the entire house, plus a new central AprilAire Space Guard filtration and iWave-R GPS ionization system upgrade (per my request) beat out the one other company who actually sent me a quote by almost half. Let me say that again differently...TWO of the four companies NEVER sent back a quote. This told me that two of the highly reputable companies in the Pelham area that have a high amount of favorable reviews simply did not want a job. Pitiful for them.

Fast forward to the install a week later...Led by two guys named Javy and Charles, they took care of making sure everything was treated with care when taking out the old ductwork so as to minimize spreading of dirt and mold as much as could be. Then, they proceeded to assemble and install all of the new system on site for custom fitting plus making sure all seams were taped properly and coated with mastic so that the chances of air leaks past the coils is forever kept at a minimum. They arrived early in the morning, and worked until the job was finished that evening (on the day of Harvey storms coming through too!).  Any questions I had concerning anything with the job was answered and explained with no hesitation on their part.  They went beyond expectations with accommodations and I just can't be any happier.

I can't say it enough in this entire description here how great Autumn Air is for an HVAC company. They want someone's business in the best way because they give the work the best service they can at reasonable prices, and offer great financing options too if needed. They understand how to go the extra mile to make sure the customer is being taken care of in the end as well. I can say I have also had the pleasure of meeting Jeff, the owner, later when he came back to look at a minor issue that crept up post install, and he is just as awesome about discussing more than the "here's what we'll do". He takes the time to explain the why and how's (if you are interested to know and ask) and will work with you as a customer to do everything he can within reason to make sure you are satisfied with him and his company. Because of all of these things described about everyone at that company and how we were treated, we now not only have clean, sanitized fresh air, but the confidence to know it will stay that way due to the complete service and professionalism we got from Autumn Air.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your review of our company!

text:
So thankful for Jeff and his team. So professional, helpful, informative, and efficient. We called the night our air conditioner went out, Jeff came that night to offer options and quotes, then they arrived and installed the very next morning. They had the air on by lunch and completed modifications by dinner. Jeff considered our concerns and needs, then offered multiple options to meet both. Leaps and bounds above the competition. They made sure everything was properly set up and running as efficiently as possible before leaving. They even cleaned up after themselves. I highly recommend, especially if you have an out of date unit and and want to reduce your power bill. Fresh, Clean, Crisp Air all thanks to Jeff and his team.

Description of work:
Heat Pump and Air Handler Replacement - increased from 4ton unit to 5ton unit - duct work modifications to accommodate increase. Original construction of our home, 12 years ago, was  rushed and the a/c and duct work was thrown together quickly and in a sloppy manner. Our duct work was constricting air flow and in need of modifications. Our power bill was astronomical. So we called Autumn Air.

name: Max Levi
text:
Autumn Air (Charles in particular), have been absolutely incredible!  My existing furnace kept cutting off in the mornings, but then it ran fine for most of the day.  It was a difficult thing to track down, and they never quit troubleshooting to get to the root of the issue so they could fix it the right way.

This took several trips, they tried several things, one at a time, to narrow it down.  Instead of changing a bunch of things or applying "band-aids", they worked hard to pinpoint the true issue.  It ended up being a piece of metal (limit) that was popping and shutting it off prematurely (before the heat limit actually occurred).  So a tiny faulty limit had to be found, and they found it.

It took a lot of patience and tedious work at times.  They just had the attitude of "I'll find the root cause no matter what it takes, and I won't stop until I find and fix it."  I truly believe others would have given up or chalked it up to an issue with my new thermostat.

I really appreciate the time and effort that was put into troubleshooting, not giving up, and finding the real issue, and fixing it the right way!

name: Deidre Stone
text: We built our house just 3 Summers ago. During that 3 years it seems like either 1 unit or the other was in a struggle and the builder's installer was at my house at least every 6 months. It just never did heat or cool correctly and ran what seemed like constantly. You can imagine my frustration in a new home. This spring we called Autumn Air. They came right out and checked everything. They even went into the attic and found an issue with a clogged drain. (which the other guys never did) The air has been so cold all Summer that we can't set it under 74 without getting a chill and my power bill is HALF of what it has been in the past! Here we are 4 months later and my technician, Baker, gives me a courtesy call to just see how things are going since the service. I can't say enough good about these guys! Affordable, professional, and quick! I won t call or recommend  anyone but Autumn Air going forward!!Thanks for taking the stress out of my Summer!

text: I have been with a different local HVAC company for the past 4 years. I had been content with them and their service until I had a repair. I had a capacitor go out and I was charged over $300 to replace it. I didn't think much about it until I shared my story with a few people who know what they are talking about. Turns out it was a steep price! I lost TRUST and confidence with them for work. I heard Autumn advertising on WDJC and thought I would check them out. Their monthly maintenance program is very reasonably priced and I even quizzed them on how much a capacitor replacement would run...much more reasonable! So I made the switch and scheduled my first maintenance visit...next day I might add and not in 6 weeks like the other. I was once again shocked at how bad my other service companies quality of work was for maintenance as Charlie showed me all of the stuff that wasn't being done! So, I am very happy I made the switch and hopeful that I have a company I can trust!

name: Lee McCarty
text: Our air conditioner decided to break down late Friday night, so I found myself in the position of trying to find someone to come out on Saturday to fix it. After calling numerous other companies that were in my area, each time just being told they had no available service time except later in the week, (none of them even asked exactly what the unit was doing, or what was wrong). I found Autumn Air online, and even though they weren't in my area, I figured I had nothing to lose trying them. My call was answered professionally, and he took my info and told me that they were pretty full for the day, but that they would try to fit me in. He asked me for details on what was wrong. After about 10 minutes, he called me back saying that they had a cancellation and a tech could be. at the house in about an hour. An hour later the tech was here and within 30 minutes we had cool air!!! I want to thank Autumn Air for taking the time to talk to me and for fitting me into their busy schedule on such a hot Saturday. The price was VERY reasonable, especially considering that it was a Saturday in the busy Summer season. I would recommend this company to everyone I know!

name: Andrew Godfrey
text:
They cleaned the carpets and they look better than they have vs any other service that has cleaned here. Having said that...

The technician/salesman will show up and try to sell you a ton of services that they will give you a great deal on because they are your friend. Decline all of it. The enzyme treatment, pretreatment, post treatment, etc.seem to largely be imaginary. I signed up for some but they did not modify what they were doing at all.

Also they will not move or clean under any piece of furniture that you do not EXPLICITLY ask them to clean under, so keep an eye on the work and speak up; they wont do anything they don't absolutely have to on their own.

Having said all of that, the carpets look great.

text: Came up to my mother in laws in Daphne and needed to get the house taken care of before we sell it.  Rugs need to be cleaned, sofa and most important the duct work cleaned out.  We called Stanley Steamer of Daphne, what a great deal.  We are so happy with the work the two brothers did to the house.  Both Chris and Dustin did an outstanding job not only with the rugs but the air duct work did wonders.  The air is cleaner and just feels great. Definitely recommend these guys, not only professional but friendly and down to earth.  Great guys and great deal!!

text: We had quite a few pet issues in the carpet and the guys came out and used a special cleaner on the areas and it got rid of all the spots and smells! Very friendly and knowledgeable. Worth calling these guys out. I added before and after pictures!

I was very pleased with the service, the professional knowledge and equipment, and friendly courtesy of the two men who came to my house.
I did upgrade the cleaning technique and add a protective treatment after the cleaning to sustain the good results.  These were good recommendations given the condition and traffic patterns of my carpet.
I won't wait 3 years again to call them!  I sincerely recommend them.

text: Chris came to clean my carpets. The company was extremely Covid-19 friendly, and he exercised extreme caution and professionalism. The carpet was heavily soiled with older stains, and they did an amazing job getting everything cleaned. He explained the process, and even altered my service because I had ordered a process that was not needed for my carpet type. He saved me money! I will be calling them again soon on my other properties.

text: Stanley Steemer is not cheap, but we were looking at the prospect of replacing all the carpet in a home we just bought. They came in and made it look like it was nearly new. Nobody cleans like these guys do. They also cleaned the tile in our shower and made it look like new as well. They just went under new ownership and the guys showed up in a brand new truck with top notch equipment. Friendly service that I would recommend to anyone. They saved us thousands.

Thank you!!

I have nothing but compliments for the Stanley Steemer team that came to my house today. I woke up to the fact that my German Short Hair decided to mark my loft banisters which meant it went alllll over the top and the bottom floor. Apparently he snuck up there before because when I went up to see what happened there were dried set stains. It was a mess.
It was about 10:30 when I called Stanley Steamer. Chris and Dustin were here by this afternoon and unbelievably got every single gross mark out of my upstairs carpeting and even cleaned the rug underneath for me. AND my house smells so good.
They explained the process, let me review what they felt should be done to take care of the problem and did a fantastic job.
Very personable clean cut guys who know their business.
Thank you for a very positive experience.

name: steve puckett
text: I would like to thank Blake and his entire team.  In the mist of the Pandemic Crisis, our washer and kitchen sink overflowed and flooded a large area of our home. Blake and team arrived at my home the very next day. They worked as a team and set about examining the situation.  They were careful to inform me and my wife of each situation and problem found. They worked to remove damaged cabinets, flooring, and drywall.  Blake painstakingly worked to remove cabinets and countertops without more damage to each of the items.  Over the next several days, Blake continued to check on our situation and closely monitored how our situation was improving.  He amazed me not only with his efficient clean-up but with his knowledge about what was needed. Blake was especially helpful in explaining what had happened and the steps they were taking. He is very helpful and conscientious. Thank you for sending such a dedicated individual (Blake) and a great team that supports him.  It was awesome to see such compatibility in the mist of our crisis.

They cared for my home and belongings as if they were their own.  Would highly recommend their services to any and all of my friends and family.

name: Gene Cochran
text:
David Monk was my technician today serving 3 units in my house. 2 weeks ago I had a new roof put on my house. David went in to the attic and immediately discovered a roofing nail lodged into the copper natural gas line. It was spewing natural gas and we immediately turned all appliances off. It could have been disastrous! 20 years ago the builder placed the copper lines too close to the roof decking. We were very close to losing our house in a possible explosion!
David serviced all 3 units, cleaned the coils and gave me an overview of the expected life of each unit. He also gave me information on a finance plan if one or all of my units fail. 60 months with 0% interest really would be a great way to finance a complete unit.

Brown Heating & Cooling has been great for my family for 25 years now!

Thanks David Monk for your professional service!!!

resp.text: We love to hear stories like this and so happy David found the problem before something terrible happened. Thank you for your continued confidence in Brown!

name: Kay Justice
text: I have done business with Brown Heating & Cooling for a number of years.  They are always great to work with and prompt in answering my questions and taking care of my heating and cooling system and their prices are very competitive.  The technicians are always courteous and efficient and are pleasant to work with.  I have never had a problem that they couldn't handle in a timely  manner.  Thank you, Brown, for you great service!

resp.text: Thank you Kay for the kind words! The team here at Brown Heating and Cooling is thrilled to hear such great feedback, and we’re proud to be one of the trusted HVAC service companies in Birmingham, Alabama.

name: Josh Rhodes
text: My technician was empathetic and caring when our HVAC motor went out. He treated it like his own problem. Great company!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review. Our technicians really do care. We call them Careoholics!

name: Joshua Patton
text: Amazing service! Came out and fixed our complicated unit on a Sunday! Would highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Joshua! We work hard to meet expectations like yours, and we’re happy to hear we hit the mark for you. Stay cool!

name: Jennifer Parsons
text: Very courteous and friendly.  Trustworthy!  Excellent service!

resp.text: Thank you very much Jennifer for your excellent review. We are had such a great experience.

name: E Holland
text: Thank you Brown Air for delivering world class service!  I've dealt with some companies in the past, who have no concept of responding timely, let alone picking up a telephone for a courtesy call to say they're on the way.  Maybe y'all should offer classes on that!  :)

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Eual! We are thrilled you’re so happy with the service you received today. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us and I agree, maybe we should teach a class on customer service.

name: Tate Holt Maddox
text: Cannot say enough about our experience with Brown. Tanner, Jason and David were amazing. The project we thought would take 3 days was completed in 1 day. I knew immediately these guys were experts. They arrived early and worked non-stop all day. They were so professional. I thought this process (new AC, furnace and duct work) would be a nightmare but I was totally wrong. We interviewed three companies. Brown beat everyone in price, warranty and availability.  Thank you Brown!!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Tate! We are thrilled you’re so happy with the service you received. Tanner, Jason and David really are fantastic technicians; we're so lucky to have them on our team. Thanks again!

name: james lawrence
text: Thank you for the great service you have given us over the past years. The servicemen as well as office staff are always very polite and respectful. They take time to share what is needed and did a very professional job at a great price. Thank you for giving back to our community by helping those in need.

resp.text: Thank you James for the great review! We are so glad to hear that you had a great experience with Brown. We train hard to make sure our team operates efficiently—glad to know it’s working! We appreciate your business and look forward to serving your HVAC needs in the future. Community service is something we feel blessed to be able to give back to those in need.

name: Vicki Williams
text: Always satisfied with the service.  David did a great job.  We have had all their employees and they all do a great job and are very friendly.

resp.text: Thank you Vicki for the great review! We are so glad to hear that you had a great experience with Brown. We train hard to make sure our team operates efficiently-glad to know it's working! We appreciate your business and look forward to serving your HVAC needs in the future.

name: Stephanie Sansing
text: Owner and staff very professional. Response time was quick. Communication with dispatcher was excellent. Technician, Derek, was clean, friendly, informative, and professional. We recommend this company.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Stephanie! We work hard to meet expectations like yours, and we’re happy to hear we hit the mark for you. We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. Stay cool!

name: Jeff Tombrello
text:
I called them and they sent an excellent technician out within the hour.  He was considerate, respectful, and took his time to explain my problems and the charges, which were very reasonable.
That was only 4 hours ago and I have already recommended this technician to two different friends if mine.

The team here at Brown Heating and Cooling is thrilled to hear such great feedback, and we’re proud to be one of the trusted HVAC service companies in Birmingham, Alabama. Also, thank you for referring us so soon. Our business is built on great referrals like yours!

text: David Monk with Brown Heating and Cooling did an excellent job on my client's recent HVAC inspection and tune up. He was very thorough and communicated well. In addition, he was very personable and so polite and put my 86 year old client at ease. Thank you, David!

text: The guys at Brown Heating & Cooling saved the day! I called them to repair my father’s unit, and they did so in a timely and professional manner. I was so impressed that I had them out to my house, where they found a part that wasn’t working like it should.  They said the part was still under warranty so I had them repair it, and they did so on the spot! I love their integrity and customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Nicole! We’re so happy the service exceeded your expectations. Would you mind sharing with your friends who are due for a check-up, too? We’d love to continue providing great service to awesome customers like you. Thanks again!

text: The workers were very professional and nice and they worked way into the night until the job was done. I was very impressed and I appreciate all the hard work. I highly recommend Brown Heating and Cooling.

text: Brown Heating and Cooling has been maintaining my two systems and when an issue arose, they were able to attend to the problem immediately and with compassion. Thank you to Derek, David, Ollie, and Jamie!

text: Both technicians were professional and timely.  The two other places seemed like they did not want to be bothered.  But Brown came out the same day and started and completed the job the next day.  The guy that came out even helped me light my water heater which was separate from the job.  Very reliable company and employees.

text: David  came out today to fix our AC. He not only fixed it but explained what he was fixing and how it worked. Simplified version. Having a service contract with Brown really saved us today. Less than 12 hour, AC is fixed even having to get replacement parts. In the heat of summer, having someone you can rely on to drop everything to fix your problem is worth millions.

resp.text: Thank you very much for such a great review! We work really hard to offer the best HVAC service, so I am happy to see you enjoyed your experience. I made sure David M. got the recognition he deserves. He was really happy to see your review.

text: I've usually guys twice now and I will be using them for now on . professional, courteous and quality work

name: Kevin Jones
text:
"Very Thorough"
Jason, my AC Tech was very professional and Thorough. He completely dismantled both units and cleaned both units. Jason worked on our units for close to two hours. A friend recommended Brown Heating and Cooling to us. I highly recommend Brown Heating and cooling. Other companies spend about a "Third" of the time that Brown spends servicing AC and heating units which tells me that the other companies are taking short cuts in my opinion.  Brown charges about$100.00 more "PER Year" but I feel it's WELL worth the price difference.

text: I am extremely pleased with this company, especially the technicians that service my A/C.  They have responded to after hour trouble calls when others would not. I can't say enough good things about the company and their technicians.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Rebecca. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us—and we agree, Chad and David are truly gems to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

name: Lisa Phillips
text: Trust is an element you must have when it comes to your HVAC needs. We've always been given great advice when it comes to servicing our old units. Derek helped us figure out a long term plan to get the most out of them before replacing them down the road. One thing we find invaluable is we have the same technician work on our units each time, which makes for a smooth experience since he is knowledgeable of past experiences and issues.

resp.text: Lisa, thank you very much for such a great review! We work really hard to offer the best HVAC service, so I am happy to see you enjoyed your experience. I made sure Derek got the recognition he deserves. He was really happy to see your review.

text: Brown serviced my heating/AC unit twice/year and kept it running smoothly.  I needed them for a major repair and they did a great job, on time and well done.

text: David and Chris did an outstanding job cleaning our whole house duct works and installing scrubbers and air cleaner. Everyone Brown Heating and Cooling are top-notch individuals and fully qualified to work on your HVAC systems. There is no other company in town I would have work on my HVAC. Totally trustworthy, dependable and professional thru and thru.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Chris! We are thrilled you’re so happy with the service you received. David and Chris really are fantastic technicians; we feel so lucky to have them on our team. Thanks again!

Brown Heating and Cooling

text: I have never had a service person show up when scheduled.  They were prompt and professional.  Highly recommend Brown Heating and Cooling!

name: Lane Hyche
text: I called Brown (Dec 4, 2019) because my heat pump was running nonstop when I went upstairs but it felt like it was cold. When Derek arrived, he immediately started gathering information about what kind of issues I was having and where. I told him about the upstairs being cold and he started with the outside before working his was to the second floor. We found that one of my attic doors had been left open by our pest control tech. Instead of stopping there, he verified that everything else was operating properly. Where others would have stopped, he wanted to make sure we didn't have another problem that may have been masked by the door being left open. He definitely went above and beyond with keeping my family comfortable. Thanks for the care you showed us.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Lane. We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us—and we agree, Derek is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

text: They do good work, they are normally available, tell you when they’re coming and show up on time. I myself have been using them for at least 15 years.
